i still can't see it in the preview

I understand your frustration—let’s get those sci-fi objects (planets, aliens, spaceships) visible in the preview of index.html. Since you’re not seeing them, the issue might be related to how you’re previewing the page, the screen size, or a potential oversight in the CSS or HTML. Let’s troubleshoot and ensure the objects are visible while maintaining the scrolling and centering fixes.

Step 1: Understand the Issue

You mentioned you can’t see the sci-fi objects (planets, aliens, spaceship) in the "preview." Since you’re accessing the site on your phone (as per previous steps), the objects might not be visible due to the media query (@media (max-width: 768px)) that hides .sci-fi-object on smaller screens to prevent lag. However, if you’re previewing on a larger screen (e.g., a desktop browser) and still can’t see them, there might be a rendering or styling issue.

Let’s break this down:

  • If Previewing on Phone: The objects are hidden because your phone’s screen width is likely ≤ 768px, triggering the media query.
  • If Previewing on Desktop: The objects should be visible unless there’s a CSS rendering issue (e.g., z-index, display, or positioning) or a browser-specific problem.
  • Other Possibilities: The browser’s developer tools "preview" mode might be simulating a mobile device, or there could be a caching issue.

Step 2: Adjust index.html to Ensure Visibility

Let’s modify the index.html to:

  1. Make Sci-Fi Objects Visible on All Screen Sizes Temporarily: We’ll remove the media query hiding the objects to confirm they render correctly, then adjust for performance.
  2. Debug Rendering Issues: Ensure the objects are positioned correctly and not obscured by other elements.
  3. Maintain Scrolling and Centering: Keep the previous fixes intact.

Updated index.html

frontend/index.html (updated):

html
<!DOCTYPE html> <html lang="en"> <head> <meta charset="UTF-8"> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0"> <title>Personal AI Logger</title> <style> /* Import Orbitron font from Google Fonts (optional) */ @import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Orbitron&display=swap'); body { margin: 0; padding: 0; min-height: 100vh; display: flex; flex-direction: column; justify-content: center; align-items: center; font-family: 'Orbitron', 'Arial', sans-serif; color: #ffffff; background: linear-gradient(135deg, #050818, #0f1a4d, #1a2a5a, #00a3cc, #00d9a9); background-size: 150% 150%; animation: sciFiGradient 20s ease infinite; position: relative; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: auto; -webkit-overflow-scrolling: touch; } @keyframes sciFiGradient { 0% { background-position: 0% 50%; } 50% { background-position: 100% 50%; } 100% { background-position: 0% 50%; } } /* Particle effect (lightweight) */ body::before { content: ''; position: fixed; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100vw; height: 100vh; background: radial-gradient(circle at 20% 30%, rgba(0, 163, 204, 0.03) 0%, transparent 60%); animation: float 25s infinite linear; z-index: -1; pointer-events: none; } @keyframes float { 0% { transform: translate(0, 0); } 100% { transform: translate(15px, 15px); } } /* Sci-fi objects */ .sci-fi-object { position: absolute; z-index: -1; pointer-events: none; display: block !important; /* Force visibility */ } /* Planet 1 */ .planet1 { width: 120px; height: 120px; background: radial-gradient(circle, #1a2a5a 0%, #00a3cc 70%, transparent 100%); top: 20%; left: 70%; animation: rotate 30s infinite linear; box-shadow: 0 0 10px rgba(0, 163, 204, 0.3); } /* Planet 2 (with rings) */ .planet2 { width: 80px; height: 80px; background: radial-gradient(circle, #2a4494 0%, #00d9a9 70%, transparent 100%); top: 60%; left: 15%; animation: rotate 40s infinite linear reverse; } .planet2::before { content: ''; position: absolute; width: 100px; height: 20px; background: rgba(0, 217, 169, 0.2); top: 50%; left: 50%; transform: translate(-50%, -50%) rotate(30deg); border-radius: 50%; box-shadow: 0 0 8px rgba(0, 217, 169, 0.3); } /* Spaceship */ .spaceship { width: 0; height: 0; border-left: 20px solid transparent; border-right: 20px solid transparent; border-bottom: 40px solid rgba(0, 163, 204, 0.5); top: 40%; left: 85%; animation: fly 15s infinite ease-in-out; box-shadow: 0 0 10px rgba(0, 163, 204, 0.5); } /* Alien */ .alien { width: 60px; height: 80px; background: radial-gradient(ellipse at center, rgba(0, 217, 169, 0.3) 0%, transparent 70%); top: 70%; left: 50%; border-radius: 50% 50% 30% 30%; animation: hover 10s infinite ease-in-out; } .alien::before { content: ''; position: absolute; width: 10px; height: 10px; background: #00d9a9; top: 20%; left: 25%; border-radius: 50%; box-shadow: 0 0 8px #00d9a9, 20px 0 0 #00d9a9, 20px 0 8px #00d9a9; } @keyframes rotate { 0% { transform: rotate(0deg); } 100% { transform: rotate(360deg); } } @keyframes fly { 0% { transform: translate(0, 0) rotate(45deg); } 50% { transform: translate(-300px, 50px) rotate(45deg); } 100% { transform: translate(0, 0) rotate(45deg); } } @keyframes hover { 0% { transform: translateY(0); } 50% { transform: translateY(-20px); } 100% { transform: translateY(0); } } h1 { font-size: 3rem; margin: 2rem 0; text-transform: uppercase; letter-spacing: 0.2rem; text-shadow: 0 0 6px #00a3cc, 0 0 10px #00d9a9, 0 0 15px #1a2a5a; animation: pulse 2s infinite alternate; will-change: text-shadow; text-align: center; } @keyframes pulse { from { text-shadow: 0 0 6px #00a3cc, 0 0 10px #00d9a9, 0 0 15px #1a2a5a; } to { text-shadow: 0 0 8px #00a3cc, 0 0 12px #00d9a9, 0 0 18px #1a2a5a; } } .button-container { display: flex; flex-wrap: wrap; gap: 2rem; justify-content: center; padding-bottom: 2rem; } button { background: linear-gradient(45deg, #0f1a4d, #00a3cc); border: none; padding: 1.2rem 2.5rem; font-size: 1.3rem; color: #ffffff; border-radius: 0.5rem; cursor: pointer; transition: transform 0.2s, box-shadow 0.3s; box-shadow: 0 4px 12px rgba(0, 163, 204, 0.3), inset 0 0 6px rgba(0, 217, 169, 0.2); text-transform: uppercase; letter-spacing: 0.1rem; position: relative; overflow: hidden; will-change: transform, box-shadow; } button::before { content: ''; position: absolute; top: 50%; left: 50%; width: 0; height: 0; background: rgba(0, 217, 169, 0.15); border-radius: 50%; transform: translate(-50%, -50%); transition: width 0.5s, height 0.5s; z-index: 0; } button:hover::before { width: 150px; height: 150px; } button:hover { transform: scale(1.05); box-shadow: 0 6px 18px rgba(0, 163, 204, 0.4), inset 0 0 8px rgba(0, 217, 169, 0.3); } button:active { transform: scale(0.95); } @media (max-width: 768px) { h1 { font-size: 2.5rem; margin: 1.5rem 0; } button { font-size: 1.2rem; padding: 1rem 2rem; } /* Removed the hiding of sci-fi objects temporarily to debug visibility */ /* .sci-fi-object { display: none; } */ } @media (max-width: 480px) { body { justify-content: flex-start; padding-top: 2rem; } h1 { font-size: 2rem; margin: 1rem 1rem 1.5rem; line-height: 1.2; } button { font-size: 1rem; padding: 0.9rem 1.5rem; } .button-container { flex-direction: column; gap: 1rem; padding-bottom: 1.5rem; } /* Scale down sci-fi objects on mobile to reduce lag */ .sci-fi-object { transform: scale(0.7); /* Reduce size by 30% */ } .spaceship { border-left: 15px solid transparent; border-right: 15px solid transparent; border-bottom: 30px solid rgba(0, 163, 204, 0.5); } } </style> </head> <body> <div class="sci-fi-object planet1"></div> <div class="sci-fi-object planet2"></div> <div class="sci-fi-object spaceship"></div> <div class="sci-fi-object alien"></div> <h1>Personal AI Logger</h1> <div class="button-container"> <button onclick="window.location.href='/live-transcription'">Live Transcription</button> <button onclick="window.location.href='/context-audio-recording'">Context Audio Recording</button> </div> </body> </html>

Changes in index.html

  1. Ensured Sci-Fi Objects Are Visible:
    • Added display: block !important to .sci-fi-object to override any potential hiding.
    • Temporarily commented out the media query that hides .sci-fi-object on screens ≤ 768px (@media (max-width: 768px)).
    • This ensures the planets, spaceship, and alien are visible on all screen sizes, including your phone, so we can confirm they render correctly.
  2. Optimized for Mobile:
    • Added a transform: scale(0.7) to .sci-fi-object on screens ≤ 480px to reduce their size on mobile, minimizing potential lag.
    • Adjusted the .spaceship size (smaller border values) on mobile to match the scaling.
  3. Maintained Previous Fixes:
    • Kept overflow-x: hidden, overflow-y: auto, and -webkit-overflow-scrolling: touch on the body for scrolling.
    • Retained centering fixes for h1 (text-align: center, justify-content, align-items).

Step 3: Test Visibility on Your Phone and Desktop

  1. Replace File:
    • Save the updated index.html in C:\CetLocal\1_Artificial intelligence\Projects\Personal-AI-Logger\frontend.
  2. Restart Uvicorn:
    • Run Uvicorn with the --host 0.0.0.0 flag:
      bash
      cd C:\CetLocal\1_Artificial intelligence\Projects\Personal-AI-Logger uvicorn backend.main:app --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8000 --reload
  3. Test on Your Phone:
    • Access http://192.168.1.100:8000 (replace with your computer’s IP) on your phone’s browser.
    • Look for the sci-fi objects:
      • Planet 1: A large planet at the top-right (20% from top, 70% from left).
      • Planet 2: A smaller planet with rings at the bottom-left (60% from top, 15% from left).
      • Spaceship: A triangle shape moving across the middle-right (40% from top, 85% from left).
      • Alien: A silhouette with glowing eyes at the bottom-center (70% from top, 50% from left).
    • Verify they are animating (rotating planets, flying spaceship, hovering alien).
  4. Test on Desktop:
    • Open http://127.0.0.1:8000 in a desktop browser (e.g., Chrome, Firefox).
    • Check if the sci-fi objects are visible and animating.
    • Use the browser’s developer tools (F12) to toggle the device toolbar and simulate a mobile device (e.g., iPhone 12) to confirm the objects are still visible.
  5. Debug:
    • Still Not Visible on Phone:
      • Open your phone’s browser developer tools (if available, or use remote debugging via Chrome’s chrome://inspect on your computer).
      • Check if .sci-fi-object elements are in the DOM but hidden (display: none or visibility: hidden).
      • Inspect their z-index (should be -1) and ensure no other elements (e.g., body::before) are overlapping with a higher z-index.
    • Not Visible on Desktop:
      • Open Chrome DevTools (F12) and inspect the .sci-fi-object elements.
      • Check for errors in the console (e.g., CSS parsing issues).
      • Verify the position: absolute and top/left values are correct.
    • Lag on Phone:
      • Since the objects are now visible on mobile, there might be slight lag. If noticeable, we can reintroduce the media query to hide them or further reduce their size/animations.

Step 4: Reintroduce Performance Optimization (If Needed)

If the sci-fi objects are visible but cause lag on your phone, let’s reintroduce the media query to hide them on smaller screens and further optimize their rendering.

Optional Adjustment (Add Back Media Query)

If performance is an issue, uncomment the media query in the @media (max-width: 768px) block:

css
@media (max-width: 768px) { h1 { font-size: 2.5rem; margin: 1.5rem 0; } button { font-size: 1.2rem; padding: 1rem 2rem; } .sci-fi-object { display: none; /* Hide on smaller screens to prevent lag */ } }

Alternatively, we can keep the objects visible but reduce their complexity:

  • Reduce animation durations (e.g., rotate to 50s).
  • Remove box-shadow from .sci-fi-object to lower rendering cost.
  • Scale down objects further (e.g., transform: scale(0.5)).

Step 5: Verify Other Functionality

  • Scrolling: Ensure you can still scroll on your phone (add temporary content like <p style="height: 200vh;">Test Scroll</p> after .button-container to test).
  • Centering: Confirm "Personal AI Logger" is centered on your phone.
  • Consistency: The live_transcription.html already has the sci-fi objects and should be unaffected, but you can test it at http://192.168.1.100:8000/live-transcription to confirm.

Additional Notes

  • Preview Context: If by "preview" you mean a specific tool (e.g., VS Code Live Server, browser dev tools device toolbar), let me know, and I can tailor the solution further. For now, I assumed you’re previewing via your phone’s browser.
  • Browser Caching: If the objects still don’t appear, clear your phone’s browser cache or use Incognito mode to rule out caching issues.
  • Next Steps: Once you confirm the sci-fi objects are visible, we can proceed to the /context-audio-recording endpoint.

Let me know if you can see the planets, aliens, and spaceship now, or if there’s still an issue!

ok let's move on to the audio-context-record endpoint which is used to record user voice speaking generated sentences and store it in the logs table here are new files in my repo frontend/audio_context_record.html frontend/audio_context_record.js backend/routes/record.py backend/services/record_service.py
2 / 2

Great! Let’s move on to implementing the /context-audio-recording endpoint, which will allow users to record their voice speaking generated sentences and store the recordings in the logs table. You’ve provided new files in your repository, so I’ll work with the following structure:

  • frontend/audio_context_record.html: The HTML template for the recording interface.
  • frontend/audio_context_record.js: The JavaScript file for handling recording functionality.
  • backend/routes/record.py: The FastAPI route for the endpoint.
  • backend/services/record_service.py: The service logic for recording and storing data.

Since I don’t have the actual content of these files yet, I’ll assume a typical structure based on the functionality you described (recording user voice, generating sentences, and storing in a logs table). I’ll provide a complete implementation for each file, and you can adjust them with the specific details from your repo if they differ. Let’s proceed step-by-step.

Step 1: Design the Functionality

The /context-audio-recording endpoint should:

  1. Generate a Sentence: Provide a random sentence for the user to read aloud (e.g., using a predefined list or an AI-generated text).
  2. Record Audio: Allow the user to record their voice via the browser’s microphone.
  3. Store the Recording: Save the audio file and associated metadata (e.g., sentence, timestamp) in the logs table.
  4. Display Logs: Show a table of previous recordings, similar to the live_transcription.html logs.

We’ll use the Web Audio API and MediaRecorder API for recording, FastAPI for the backend, and a database (assuming SQLite or a similar setup from your previous context) to store the logs.

Step 2: Implement the Files

frontend/audio_context_record.html

This file will contain the UI for recording, displaying the sentence, and showing the logs table.

frontend/audio_context_record.html:

html
<!DOCTYPE html> <html lang="en"> <head> <meta charset="UTF-8"> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0"> <title>Context Audio Recording</title> <style> @import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Orbitron&display=swap'); body { margin: 0; padding: 0; min-height: 100vh; display: flex; flex-direction: column; align-items: center; font-family: 'Orbitron', 'Arial', sans-serif; color: #ffffff; background: linear-gradient(135deg, #050818, #0f1a4d, #1a2a5a, #00a3cc, #00d9a9); background-size: 150% 150%; animation: sciFiGradient 20s ease infinite; position: relative; overflow-x: hidden; overflow-y: auto; -webkit-overflow-scrolling: touch; } @keyframes sciFiGradient { 0% { background-position: 0% 50%; } 50% { background-position: 100% 50%; } 100% { background-position: 0% 50%; } } body::before { content: ''; position: fixed; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100vw; height: 100vh; background: radial-gradient(circle at 20% 30%, rgba(0, 163, 204, 0.03) 0%, transparent 60%); animation: float 25s infinite linear; z-index: -1; pointer-events: none; } .sci-fi-object { position: absolute; z-index: -1; pointer-events: none; } .planet1 { width: 120px; height: 120px; background: radial-gradient(circle, #1a2a5a 0%, #00a3cc 70%, transparent 100%); top: 25%; left: 75%; animation: rotate 30s infinite linear; } .planet2 { width: 80px; height: 80px; background: radial-gradient(circle, #2a4494 0%, #00d9a9 70%, transparent 100%); top: 65%; left: 20%; animation: rotate 40s infinite linear reverse; } .planet2::before { content: ''; position: absolute; width: 100px; height: 20px; background: rgba(0, 217, 169, 0.2); top: 50%; left: 50%; transform: translate(-50%, -50%) rotate(30deg); border-radius: 50%; } .spaceship { width: 0; height: 0; border-left: 20px solid transparent; border-right: 20px solid transparent; border-bottom: 40px solid rgba(0, 163, 204, 0.5); top: 45%; left: 80%; animation: fly 15s infinite ease-in-out; } .alien { width: 60px; height: 80px; background: radial-gradient(ellipse at center, rgba(0, 217, 169, 0.3) 0%, transparent 70%); top: 75%; left: 55%; border-radius: 50% 50% 30% 30%; animation: hover 10s infinite ease-in-out; } .alien::before { content: ''; position: absolute; width: 10px; height: 10px; background: #00d9a9; top: 20%; left: 25%; border-radius: 50%; box-shadow: 0 0 8px #00d9a9, 20px 0 0 #00d9a9, 20px 0 8px #00d9a9; } @keyframes rotate { 0% { transform: rotate(0deg); } 100% { transform: rotate(360deg); } } @keyframes fly { 0% { transform: translate(0, 0) rotate(45deg); } 50% { transform: translate(-300px, 50px) rotate(45deg); } 100% { transform: translate(0, 0) rotate(45deg); } } @keyframes hover { 0% { transform: translateY(0); } 50% { transform: translateY(-20px); } 100% { transform: translateY(0); } } h1 { font-size: 2.5rem; margin-top: 2rem; margin-bottom: 1rem; text-transform: uppercase; letter-spacing: 0.2rem; text-shadow: 0 0 6px #00a3cc, 0 0 10px #00d9a9, 0 0 15px #1a2a5a; animation: pulse 2s infinite alternate; text-align: center; } @keyframes pulse { from { text-shadow: 0 0 6px #00a3cc, 0 0 10px #00d9a9, 0 0 15px #1a2a5a; } to { text-shadow: 0 0 8px #00a3cc, 0 0 12px #00d9a9, 0 0 18px #1a2a5a; } } .button-container { display: flex; justify-content: center; gap: 1vw; margin: 1vh 0; flex-wrap: wrap; padding-bottom: 1rem; } .control-button { background: linear-gradient(45deg, #0f1a4d, #00a3cc); border: none; padding: 1.2rem 2.5rem; font-size: 1.2rem; color: #ffffff; border-radius: 0.5rem; cursor: pointer; transition: transform 0.2s; box-shadow: 0 5px 15px rgba(0, 163, 204, 0.4); text-transform: uppercase; letter-spacing: 0.1rem; } .control-button:hover { transform: scale(1.05); } .control-button:active { transform: scale(0.95); } .control-button:disabled { background: #555; cursor: not-allowed; box-shadow: none; } #sentence { margin-top: 2vh; font-size: 1.5rem; padding: 1.5vw; border: 0.2rem solid #00a3cc; border-radius: 1rem; background-color: rgba(5, 8, 24, 0.9); width: 85%; text-align: center; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0, 163, 204, 0.3); } #recordingStatus { margin-top: 1vh; font-size: 1rem; color: #00d9a9; text-shadow: 0 0 4px #00d9a9; } #logsTableContainer { margin-top: 2vh; width: 90%; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; overflow-y: auto; max-height: 40vh; padding-bottom: 1rem; } table { width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; margin-top: 1vh; background: linear-gradient(to bottom, rgba(5, 8, 24, 0.9), rgba(15, 26, 77, 0.9)); border-radius: 1rem; overflow: hidden; box-shadow: 0 0 15px rgba(0, 163, 204, 0.2); } th { background: linear-gradient(to bottom, #00a3cc, #1a2a5a); color: #ffffff; padding: 1.5vw; text-align: left; border-bottom: 0.2rem solid #00d9a9; font-size: 1.2rem; text-transform: uppercase; letter-spacing: 0.1rem; } td { padding: 1.2vw; text-align: left; border-bottom: 0.1rem solid #1a2a5a; color: #d0d0d0; font-size: 1rem; } audio { width: 100%; background: rgba(5, 8, 24, 0.9); border-radius: 0.5rem; box-shadow: inset 0 0 4px #00a3cc; } .delete-button { background: linear-gradient(45deg, #800000, #cc0000); border: none; padding: 0.5rem 1rem; font-size: 0.9rem; color: #ffffff; border-radius: 0.3rem; cursor: pointer; transition: transform 0.2s; box-shadow: 0 3px 8px rgba(204, 0, 0, 0.4); } .delete-button:hover { transform: scale(1.05); } .delete-button:active { transform: scale(0.95); } .modal { display: none; position: fixed; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; background: rgba(5, 8, 24, 0.9); z-index: 1000; justify-content: center; align-items: center; overflow-y: auto; } .modal-content { background: linear-gradient(to bottom, rgba(15, 26, 77, 0.9), rgba(5, 8, 24, 0.9)); padding: 2rem; border-radius: 0.5rem; box-shadow: 0 0 15px rgba(204, 0, 0, 0.5); text-align: center; width: 90%; max-width: 400px; color: #cc0000; text-shadow: 0 0 5px #cc0000; animation: fadeIn 0.3s; } @keyframes fadeIn { from { opacity: 0; } to { opacity: 1; } } .modal-content h2 { font-size: 1.5rem; margin-bottom: 1rem; } .modal-buttons { display: flex; justify-content: space-around; margin-top: 1.5rem; } .modal-button { background: linear-gradient(45deg, #800000, #cc0000); border: none; padding: 0.8rem 1.5rem; font-size: 1rem; color: #ffffff; border-radius: 0.3rem; cursor: pointer; transition: transform 0.2s; box-shadow: 0 3px 8px rgba(204, 0, 0, 0.4); } .modal-button:hover { transform: scale(1.05); } .modal-button:active { transform: scale(0.95); } .modal-button.cancel { background: linear-gradient(45deg, #424242, #757575); } @media (max-width: 768px) { #sentence { width: 95%; } .control-button { font-size: 1rem; padding: 1rem 2rem; } th { font-size: 1rem; padding: 2vw; } td { font-size: 0.9rem; padding: 1.5vw; } .button-container { flex-direction: column; gap: 1vh; } #logsTableContainer { width: 100%; } .delete-button { font-size: 0.8rem; padding: 0.4rem 0.8rem; } .modal-content { padding: 1.5rem; } .modal-button { font-size: 0.9rem; padding: 0.6rem 1.2rem; } .sci-fi-object { display: none; /* Hide on mobile to reduce lag */ } } @media (max-width: 480px) { body { padding-top: 2rem; } h1 { font-size: 1.8rem; margin: 1rem 1rem 1.5rem; line-height: 1.2; } #sentence { width: 100%; font-size: 1.2rem; padding: 2.5vw; } .control-button { font-size: 0.9rem; padding: 0.8rem 1.5rem; } th { font-size: 0.9rem; padding: 2.5vw; } td { font-size: 0.8rem; padding: 2vw; } #recordingStatus { font-size: 0.9rem; } .delete-button { font-size: 0.7rem; padding: 0.3rem 0.6rem; } .modal-content { padding: 1rem; } .modal-button { font-size: 0.8rem; padding: 0.5rem 1rem; } } </style> </head> <body> <div class="sci-fi-object planet1"></div> <div class="sci-fi-object planet2"></div> <div class="sci-fi-object spaceship"></div> <div class="sci-fi-object alien"></div> <h1>Context Audio Recording</h1> <div class="button-container"> <button id="generateSentence" class="control-button">Generate Sentence</button> <button id="startRecording" class="control-button" disabled>Start Recording</button> <button id="stopRecording" class="control-button" disabled>Stop Recording</button> <button id="saveRecording" class="control-button" disabled>Save Recording</button> <button id="showLogsButton" class="control-button">Show Logs</button> </div> <div id="sentence">Click "Generate Sentence" to start.</div> <div id="recordingStatus"></div> <div id="logsTableContainer"> <h3>Recording Logs</h3> <table id="logsTable"> <thead> <tr> <th>ID</th> <th>Sentence</th> <th>Audio File</th> <th>Timestamp</th> <th>Action</th> </tr> </thead> <tbody id="logsTableBody"></tbody> </table> </div> <div id="deleteModal" class="modal"> <div class="modal-content"> <h2>Confirm Deletion</h2> <p>Are you sure you want to delete this recording?</p> <div class="modal-buttons"> <button id="confirmDelete" class="modal-button">Yes</button> <button id="cancelDelete" class="modal-button cancel">No</button> </div> </div> </div> <script src="/static/audio_context_record.js"></script> </body> </html>

Notes:

  • The UI mirrors live_transcription.html with buttons for generating a sentence, recording, saving, and viewing logs.
  • Sci-fi objects are included but hidden on mobile (≤ 768px) to prevent lag.
  • The #sentence div displays the text to read, and #recordingStatus shows recording feedback.

frontend/audio_context_record.js

This file handles the recording logic, sentence generation, and interaction with the backend.

frontend/audio_context_record.js:

javascript
document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', () => { const generateSentenceBtn = document.getElementById('generateSentence'); const startRecordingBtn = document.getElementById('startRecording'); const stopRecordingBtn = document.getElementById('stopRecording'); const saveRecordingBtn = document.getElementById('saveRecording'); const showLogsBtn = document.getElementById('showLogsButton'); const sentenceDiv = document.getElementById('sentence'); const recordingStatus = document.getElementById('recordingStatus'); const logsTableBody = document.getElementById('logsTableBody'); const deleteModal = document.getElementById('deleteModal'); const confirmDeleteBtn = document.getElementById('confirmDelete'); const cancelDeleteBtn = document.getElementById('cancelDelete'); let mediaRecorder; let audioChunks = []; let currentSentence = ''; // Generate a random sentence const sentences = [ "The spaceship hovered silently above the alien planet.", "A mysterious signal came from the edge of the galaxy.", "The robot repaired the damaged starship in record time.", "Green lights flickered in the distant nebula.", "The captain ordered a course change to avoid the asteroid field." ]; generateSentenceBtn.addEventListener('click', () => { currentSentence = sentences[Math.floor(Math.random() * sentences.length)]; sentenceDiv.textContent = currentSentence; startRecordingBtn.disabled = false; recordingStatus.textContent = 'Ready to record.'; }); // Request microphone access and start recording startRecordingBtn.addEventListener('click', async () => { try { const stream = await navigator.mediaDevices.getUserMedia({ audio: true }); mediaRecorder = new MediaRecorder(stream); audioChunks = []; mediaRecorder.ondataavailable = (event) => { audioChunks.push(event.data); }; mediaRecorder.onstop = () => { const audioBlob = new Blob(audioChunks, { type: 'audio/wav' }); const audioUrl = URL.createObjectURL(audioBlob); saveRecordingBtn.disabled = false; saveRecordingBtn.dataset.audioBlob = audioBlob; // Store blob for saving recordingStatus.textContent = 'Recording stopped. Click "Save" to store.'; }; mediaRecorder.start(); startRecordingBtn.disabled = true; stopRecordingBtn.disabled = false; recordingStatus.textContent = 'Recording...'; } catch (error) { recordingStatus.textContent = `Error accessing microphone: ${error.message}`; } }); // Stop recording stopRecordingBtn.addEventListener('click', () => { if (mediaRecorder && mediaRecorder.state === 'recording') { mediaRecorder.stop(); stopRecordingBtn.disabled = true; } }); // Save recording to server saveRecordingBtn.addEventListener('click', async () => { const audioBlob = saveRecordingBtn.dataset.audioBlob; if (!audioBlob || !currentSentence) { recordingStatus.textContent = 'No recording or sentence to save.'; return; } const formData = new FormData(); formData.append('audio', audioBlob, 'recording.wav'); formData.append('sentence', currentSentence); formData.append('timestamp', new Date().toISOString()); try { const response = await fetch('/context-audio-recording/save', { method: 'POST', body: formData }); const data = await response.json(); if (response.ok) { recordingStatus.textContent = 'Recording saved successfully!'; loadLogs(); startRecordingBtn.disabled = false; saveRecordingBtn.disabled = true; delete saveRecordingBtn.dataset.audioBlob; } else { recordingStatus.textContent = `Error: ${data.detail}`; } } catch (error) { recordingStatus.textContent = `Error saving recording: ${error.message}`; } }); // Show logs showLogsBtn.addEventListener('click', () => { loadLogs(); }); // Load logs from server async function loadLogs() { try { const response = await fetch('/context-audio-recording/logs'); const logs = await response.json(); logsTableBody.innerHTML = ''; logs.forEach(log => { const row = document.createElement('tr'); row.innerHTML = ` <td>${log.id}</td> <td>${log.sentence}</td> <td><audio controls src="/audio/${log.filename}"></audio></td> <td>${new Date(log.timestamp).toLocaleString()}</td> <td><button class="delete-button" data-id="${log.id}">Delete</button></td> `; logsTableBody.appendChild(row); }); // Add delete event listeners document.querySelectorAll('.delete-button').forEach(button => { button.addEventListener('click', () => { const logId = button.dataset.id; deleteModal.style.display = 'flex'; confirmDeleteBtn.onclick = () => deleteLog(logId); cancelDeleteBtn.onclick = () => (deleteModal.style.display = 'none'); }); }); } catch (error) { console.error('Error loading logs:', error); } } // Delete log async function deleteLog(logId) { try { const response = await fetch(`/context-audio-recording/delete/${logId}`, { method: 'DELETE' }); if (response.ok) { deleteModal.style.display = 'none'; loadLogs(); } } catch (error) { console.error('Error deleting log:', error); } } // Initial load loadLogs(); });

Notes:

  • Uses the Web Audio API to record audio via the microphone.
  • Generates a random sentence from a predefined list (you can replace this with an AI-generated sentence via a backend call).
  • Sends the audio blob and metadata to the backend via a POST request.
  • Fetches and displays logs with playable audio and a delete option.
  • Includes a modal for confirming deletions.

backend/routes/record.py

This file defines the FastAPI routes for the endpoint.

backend/routes/record.py:

python
from fastapi import APIRouter, UploadFile, Form, HTTPException from fastapi.responses import JSONResponse from backend.services.record_service import save_recording, get_logs, delete_log from pathlib import Path import uuid import shutil router = APIRouter() @router.post("/context-audio-recording/save") async def save_audio_recording(audio: UploadFile, sentence: str = Form(...), timestamp: str = Form(...)): try: # Generate a unique filename filename = f"{uuid.uuid4()}.wav" file_path = Path("audio") / filename # Save the audio file with open(file_path, "wb") as buffer: shutil.copyfileobj(audio.file, buffer) # Save to logs table log_id = save_recording(sentence, filename, timestamp) return JSONResponse({"message": "Recording saved", "id": log_id}) except Exception as e: raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e)) @router.get("/context-audio-recording/logs") async def get_audio_logs(): try: logs = get_logs() return logs except Exception as e: raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e)) @router.delete("/context-audio-recording/delete/{log_id}") async def delete_audio_log(log_id: int): try: success = delete_log(log_id) if success: return JSONResponse({"message": "Log deleted"}) raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Log not found") except Exception as e: raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e))

Notes:

  • Handles POST requests to save recordings, GET requests to fetch logs, and DELETE requests to remove logs.
  • Uses UploadFile to handle the audio blob and Form for metadata.
  • Stores files in an audio directory (create this directory in your project root if it doesn’t exist).

backend/services/record_service.py

This file contains the business logic for interacting with the database.

backend/services/record_service.py:

python
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session from backend.database import SessionLocal, Base, engine from datetime import datetime import os # Define the Log model (assuming SQLite) Base.metadata.create_all(bind=engine) class Log(Base): __tablename__ = "audio_logs" id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True, index=True) sentence = Column(String, index=True) filename = Column(String, unique=True, index=True) timestamp = Column(DateTime) # Dependency to get DB session def get_db(): db = SessionLocal() try: yield db finally: db.close() def save_recording(sentence: str, filename: str, timestamp: str): db = next(get_db()) log = Log(sentence=sentence, filename=filename, timestamp=datetime.fromisoformat(timestamp)) db.add(log) db.commit() db.refresh(log) return log.id def get_logs(): db = next(get_db()) logs = db.query(Log).all() return [{"id": log.id, "sentence": log.sentence, "filename": log.filename, "timestamp": log.timestamp} for log in logs] def delete_log(log_id: int): db = next(get_db()) log = db.query(Log).filter(Log.id == log_id).first() if log: file_path = Path("audio") / log.filename if file_path.exists(): os.remove(file_path) db.delete(log) db.commit() return True return False

Notes:

  • Assumes a SQLAlchemy setup with a database.py file defining the engine and session (similar to your previous context).
  • Creates an audio_logs table with columns for id, sentence, filename, and timestamp.
  • Saves recordings, retrieves logs, and deletes both database entries and audio files.

backend/database.py (If Not Already Present)

If you don’t have this file, create it to set up the database connection.

backend/database.py:

python
from sqlalchemy import create_engine from sqlalchemy.ext.declarative import declarative_base from sqlalchemy.orm import sessionmaker SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URL = "sqlite:///./audio_logs.db" engine = create_engine(SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URL, connect_args={"check_same_thread": False}) SessionLocal = sessionmaker(autocommit=False, autoflush=False, bind=engine) Base = declarative_base()

Notes:

  • Uses SQLite for simplicity. Adjust the URL if you’re using a different database (e.g., PostgreSQL).

Step 3: Set Up the Project

  1. Create Directory Structure:
    • Ensure the following directories exist:
      • audio/ (in the project root for storing audio files).
      • static/ (in the project root for serving JS files; move audio_context_record.js here).
  2. Update main.py: Add the router to your FastAPI app in backend/main.py:
    python
    from fastapi import FastAPI from backend.routes import record app = FastAPI() app.include_router(record.router)
  3. Serve Static Files: Add static file serving in main.py if not already present:
    python
    from fastapi.staticfiles import StaticFiles app.mount("/static", StaticFiles(directory="static"), name="static") app.mount("/audio", StaticFiles(directory="audio"), name="audio")
  4. Run the Server:
    bash
    cd C:\CetLocal\1_Artificial intelligence\Projects\Personal-AI-Logger uvicorn backend.main:app --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8000 --reload

Step 4: Test the Endpoint

  1. Access the Page:
    • On your phone or desktop, go to http://192.168.1.100:8000/context-audio-recording (replace with your IP).
  2. Test Workflow:
    • Click "Generate Sentence" to get a random sentence.
    • Click "Start Recording," speak the sentence, then click "Stop Recording."
    • Click "Save Recording" to store the audio and metadata.
    • Click "Show Logs" to view the table with the saved recording.
    • Play the audio and test the delete functionality.
  3. Debug:
    • Microphone Access: Ensure your browser has microphone permissions.
    • 404 Errors: Check if /static/audio_context_record.js and /audio/ paths are correct.
    • Database Errors: Verify the audio_logs.db file is created and writable.

Additional Notes

  • Sentence Generation: The current implementation uses a hardcoded list. For AI-generated sentences, integrate with a service (e.g., OpenAI via an API call in the backend).
  • Audio Format: The code uses WAV; adjust to MP3 or another format if needed by changing the Blob type and backend handling.
  • Security: Add authentication or file size limits for production use.
  • Performance: The sci-fi objects are hidden on mobile (≤ 768px), so there should be no lag.

Please share the contents of your new files if they differ, and I’ll adjust the implementation accordingly. Let me know how the testing goes or if you need further tweaks!

make use of the old database and some other predefined methods in log.py

Thank you for the clarification! Since you're referring to using the old database and predefined methods from log.py, I’ll assume the following based on your previous context (e.g., the live_transcription.html logs table and related backend logic):

  • The existing database (audio_logs.db or similar) already contains a logs table (or similar) used for the transcription logs, and we should extend it to include context audio recordings.
  • There’s a log.py file (likely backend/log.py or similar) with predefined methods (e.g., for adding, retrieving, or deleting logs) that we should reuse instead of redefining them in record_service.py.

I’ll adjust the implementation to:

  1. Use the existing audio_logs.db database.
  2. Integrate with predefined methods from log.py (I’ll infer common method names like add_log, get_logs, and delete_log unless you provide the exact file).
  3. Ensure compatibility with the live_transcription.html logs table structure while adding support for the new /context-audio-recording endpoint.

Since I don’t have the exact content of your log.py, I’ll make reasonable assumptions and provide a template. Please share the log.py file or its methods if they differ, and I’ll refine the solution.

Step 1: Assumptions

  • Database: The existing audio_logs.db uses SQLAlchemy with a logs table that includes columns like id, text (for transcription), filename (for audio), timestamp, and possibly others. We’ll extend it to include a sentence column for context recordings.
  • log.py: Contains methods like:
    • add_log(db, text, filename, timestamp): Adds a new log entry.
    • get_logs(db): Retrieves all logs.
    • delete_log(db, log_id): Deletes a log by ID.
  • File Structure: The audio/ directory and static file serving are already set up from the previous context.

If these assumptions are incorrect, please provide the log.py content or clarify the method names and table structure.

Step 2: Update the Files

Update Database Model (backend/database.py)

Ensure the logs table includes a sentence column for context recordings. Modify or verify the existing model:

backend/database.py:

python
from sqlalchemy import create_engine, Column, Integer, String, DateTime from sqlalchemy.ext.declarative import declarative_base from sqlalchemy.orm import sessionmaker SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URL = "sqlite:///./audio_logs.db" engine = create_engine(SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URL, connect_args={"check_same_thread": False}) SessionLocal = sessionmaker(autocommit=False, autoflush=False, bind=engine) Base = declarative_base() class Log(Base): __tablename__ = "logs" id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True, index=True) text = Column(String, index=True) # For live transcription sentence = Column(String, index=True) # For context recording filename = Column(String, unique=True, index=True) timestamp = Column(DateTime) Base.metadata.create_all(bind=engine) def get_db(): db = SessionLocal() try: yield db finally: db.close()

Notes:

  • Added sentence column to differentiate context recordings from live transcriptions.
  • text remains for live transcription compatibility.

Use Existing log.py Methods

Assuming backend/log.py exists with the following methods (adjust based on your actual file):

backend/log.py (Example Template):

python
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session from backend.database import Log, get_db def add_log(db: Session, text: str = None, sentence: str = None, filename: str = None, timestamp: str = None): log = Log(text=text, sentence=sentence, filename=filename, timestamp=timestamp) db.add(log) db.commit() db.refresh(log) return log.id def get_logs(db: Session): return db.query(Log).all() def delete_log(db: Session, log_id: int): log = db.query(Log).filter(Log.id == log_id).first() if log: db.delete(log) db.commit() return True return False

Notes:

  • add_log now accepts an optional sentence parameter alongside text to support both use cases.
  • If your log.py has different method signatures or logic, replace this with your actual code.

backend/routes/record.py

Update the routes to use log.py methods.

backend/routes/record.py:

python
from fastapi import APIRouter, UploadFile, Form, HTTPException from fastapi.responses import JSONResponse from backend.log import add_log, get_logs, delete_log from backend.database import get_db from pathlib import Path import uuid import shutil import os router = APIRouter() @router.post("/context-audio-recording/save") async def save_audio_recording(audio: UploadFile, sentence: str = Form(...), timestamp: str = Form(...)): try: # Generate a unique filename filename = f"{uuid.uuid4()}.wav" file_path = Path("audio") / filename # Save the audio file with open(file_path, "wb") as buffer: shutil.copyfileobj(audio.file, buffer) # Save to logs table using log.py db = next(get_db()) log_id = add_log(db, sentence=sentence, filename=filename, timestamp=timestamp) return JSONResponse({"message": "Recording saved", "id": log_id}) except Exception as e: raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e)) @router.get("/context-audio-recording/logs") async def get_audio_logs(): try: db = next(get_db()) logs = get_logs(db) return [ { "id": log.id, "sentence": log.sentence if log.sentence else log.text, # Use sentence or text "filename": log.filename, "timestamp": log.timestamp.isoformat() if log.timestamp else None } for log in logs ] except Exception as e: raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e)) @router.delete("/context-audio-recording/delete/{log_id}") async def delete_audio_log(log_id: int): try: db = next(get_db()) log = db.query(Log).filter(Log.id == log_id).first() if log and delete_log(db, log_id): file_path = Path("audio") / log.filename if file_path.exists(): os.remove(file_path) return JSONResponse({"message": "Log deleted"}) raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Log not found") except Exception as e: raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e))

Notes:

  • Removed record_service.py and imported methods from log.py.
  • save_audio_recording uses add_log with sentence instead of text.
  • get_audio_logs returns logs, prioritizing sentence over text for context recordings.
  • delete_audio_log integrates file deletion with the existing delete_log method.

frontend/audio_context_record.html

Update the HTML to match the new logic (no major changes needed, but ensure consistency).

frontend/audio_context_record.html (Updated):

html

animation: hover 10s infinite ease-in-out; } .alien::before { content: ''; position: absolute; width: 10px; height: 10px; background: #00d9a9; top: 20%; left: 25%; border-radius: 50%; box-shadow: 0 0 8px #00d9a9, 20px 0 0 #00d9a9, 20px 0 8px #00d9a9; } 100% { transform: translate(0, 0) rotate(45deg); } } @keyframes hover { 0% { transform: translateY(0); } 50% { transform: translateY(-20px); } 100% { transform: translateY(0); } } h1 { font-size: 2.5rem; margin-top: 2rem; margin-bottom: 1rem; text-transform: uppercase; letter-spacing: 0.2rem; text-shadow: 0 0 6px #00a3cc, 0 0 10px #00d9a9, 0 0 15px #1a2a5a; animation: pulse 2s infinite alternate; text-align: center; } @keyframes pulse { from { text-shadow: 0 0 6px #00a3cc, 0 0 10px #00d9a9, 0 0 15px #1a2a5a; } to { text-shadow: 0 0 8px #00a3cc, 0 0 12px #00d9a9, 0 0 18px #1a2a5a; } } .button-container { display: flex; justify-content: center; gap: 1vw; margin: 1vh 0; flex-wrap: wrap; padding-bottom: 1rem; } .control-button { background: linear-gradient(45deg, #0f1a4d, #00a3cc); border: none; padding: 1.2rem 2.5rem; font-size: 1.2rem; color: #ffffff; border-radius: 0.5rem; cursor: pointer; transition: transform 0.2s; box-shadow: 0 5px 15px rgba(0, 163, 204, 0.4); text-transform: uppercase; letter-spacing: 0.1rem; } .control-button:hover { transform: scale(1.05); } .control-button:active { transform: scale(0.95); } .control-button:disabled { background: #555; cursor: not-allowed; box-shadow: none; } #sentence { margin-top: 2vh; font-size: 1.5rem; padding: 1.5vw; border: 0.2rem solid #00a3cc; border-radius: 1rem; background-color: rgba(5, 8, 24, 0.9); width: 85%; text-align: center; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0, 163, 204, 0.3); } #recordingStatus { margin-top: 1vh; font-size: 1rem; color: #00d9a9; text-shadow: 0 0 4px #00d9a9; } #logsTableContainer { margin-top: 2vh; width: 90%; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; overflow-y: auto; max-height: 40vh; padding-bottom: 1rem; } table { width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; margin-top: 1vh; background: linear-gradient(to bottom, rgba(5, 8, 24, 0.9), rgba(15, 26, 77, 0.9)); border-radius: 1rem; overflow: hidden; box-shadow: 0 0 15px rgba(0, 163, 204, 0.2); } th { background: linear-gradient(to bottom, #00a3cc, #1a2a5a); color: #ffffff; padding: 1.5vw; text-align: left; border-bottom: 0.2rem solid #00d9a9; font-size: 1.2rem; text-transform: uppercase; letter-spacing: 0.1rem; } td { padding: 1.2vw; text-align: left; border-bottom: 0.1rem solid #1a2a5a; color: #d0d0d0; font-size: 1rem; } audio { width: 100%; font-size: 0.9rem; color: #ffffff; border-radius: 0.3rem; cursor: pointer; transition: transform 0.2s; box-shadow: 0 3px 8px rgba(204, 0, 0, 0.4); } .delete-button:hover { transform: scale(1.05); } .delete-button:active { transform: scale(0.95); } .modal { display: none; position: fixed; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; background: rgba(5, 8, 24, 0.9); z-index: 1000; justify-content: center; align-items: center; overflow-y: auto; } .modal-content { background: linear-gradient(to bottom, rgba(15, 26, 77, 0.9), rgba(5, 8, 24, 0.9)); box-shadow: 0 3px 8px rgba(204, 0, 0, 0.4); } .modal-button:hover { transform: scale(1.05); } .modal-button:active { transform: scale(0.95); } .modal-button.cancel { background: linear-gradient(45deg, #424242, #757575); } .delete-button { font-size: 0.7rem; padding: 0.3rem 0.6rem; } .modal-content { padding: 1rem; } .modal-button { font-size: 0.8rem; padding: 0.5rem 1rem; } } </style> </head> <body> <div class="sci-fi-object planet1"></div> <div class="sci-fi-object planet2"></div> <div class="sci-fi-object spaceship"></div> <div class="sci-fi-object alien"></div> <h1>Context Audio Recording</h1> <div class="button-container"> <button id="generateSentence" class="control-button">Generate Sentence</button> <button id="startRecording" class="control-button" disabled>Start Recording</button> <button id="stopRecording" class="control-button" disabled>Stop Recording</button> <button id="saveRecording" class="control-button" disabled>Save Recording</button> <button id="showLogsButton" class="control-button">Show Logs</button> </div> <div id="sentence">Click "Generate Sentence" to start.</div> <div id="recordingStatus"></div> <div id="logsTableContainer"> <h3>Recording Logs</h3> <table id="logsTable"> <thead> <tr> <th>ID</th> <th>Sentence</th> <th>Audio File</th> <th>Timestamp</th> <th>Action</th> </tr> </thead> <tbody id="logsTableBody"></tbody> </table> </div> <div id="deleteModal" class="modal"> <div class="modal-content"> <h2>Confirm Deletion</h2> <p>Are you sure you want to delete this recording?</p> <div class="modal-buttons"> <button id="confirmDelete" class="modal-button">Yes</button> <button id="cancelDelete" class="modal-button cancel">No</button> </div> </div> </div> <script src="/static/audio_context_record.js"></script> </body> </html>

Notes:

  • No significant changes; ensures compatibility with the updated backend.

frontend/audio_context_record.js

Update the JS to use the new endpoint paths.

frontend/audio_context_record.js:

javascript
document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', () => { const generateSentenceBtn = document.getElementById('generateSentence'); const startRecordingBtn = document.getElementById('startRecording'); const stopRecordingBtn = document.getElementById('stopRecording'); const saveRecordingBtn = document.getElementById('saveRecording'); const showLogsBtn = document.getElementById('showLogsButton'); const sentenceDiv = document.getElementById('sentence'); const recordingStatus = document.getElementById('recordingStatus'); const logsTableBody = document.getElementById('logsTableBody'); const deleteModal = document.getElementById('deleteModal'); const confirmDeleteBtn = document.getElementById('confirmDelete'); const cancelDeleteBtn = document.getElementById('cancelDelete'); let mediaRecorder; let audioChunks = []; let currentSentence = ''; // Generate a random sentence const sentences = [ "The spaceship hovered silently above the alien planet.", "A mysterious signal came from the edge of the galaxy.", "The robot repaired the damaged starship in record time.", "Green lights flickered in the distant nebula.", "The captain ordered a course change to avoid the asteroid field." ]; generateSentenceBtn.addEventListener('click', () => { currentSentence = sentences[Math.floor(Math.random() * sentences.length)]; sentenceDiv.textContent = currentSentence; startRecordingBtn.disabled = false; recordingStatus.textContent = 'Ready to record.'; }); // Request microphone access and start recording startRecordingBtn.addEventListener('click', async () => { try { const stream = await navigator.mediaDevices.getUserMedia({ audio: true }); mediaRecorder = new MediaRecorder(stream); audioChunks = []; mediaRecorder.ondataavailable = (event) => { audioChunks.push(event.data); }; mediaRecorder.onstop = () => { const audioBlob = new Blob(audioChunks, { type: 'audio/wav' }); const audioUrl = URL.createObjectURL(audioBlob); saveRecordingBtn.disabled = false; saveRecordingBtn.dataset.audioBlob = audioBlob; recordingStatus.textContent = 'Recording stopped. Click "Save" to store.'; }; mediaRecorder.start(); startRecordingBtn.disabled = true; stopRecordingBtn.disabled = false; recordingStatus.textContent = 'Recording...'; } catch (error) { recordingStatus.textContent = `Error accessing microphone: ${error.message}`; } }); // Stop recording stopRecordingBtn.addEventListener('click', () => { if (mediaRecorder && mediaRecorder.state === 'recording') { mediaRecorder.stop(); stopRecordingBtn.disabled = true; } }); // Save recording to server saveRecordingBtn.addEventListener('click', async () => { const audioBlob = saveRecordingBtn.dataset.audioBlob; if (!audioBlob || !currentSentence) { recordingStatus.textContent = 'No recording or sentence to save.'; return; } const formData = new FormData(); formData.append('audio', audioBlob, 'recording.wav'); formData.append('sentence', currentSentence); formData.append('timestamp', new Date().toISOString()); try { const response = await fetch('/context-audio-recording/save', { method: 'POST', body: formData }); const data = await response.json(); if (response.ok) { recordingStatus.textContent = 'Recording saved successfully!'; loadLogs(); startRecordingBtn.disabled = false; saveRecordingBtn.disabled = true; delete saveRecordingBtn.dataset.audioBlob; } else { recordingStatus.textContent = `Error: ${data.detail}`; } } catch (error) { recordingStatus.textContent = `Error saving recording: ${error.message}`; } }); // Show logs showLogsBtn.addEventListener('click', () => { loadLogs(); }); // Load logs from server async function loadLogs() { try { const response = await fetch('/context-audio-recording/logs'); const logs = await response.json(); logsTableBody.innerHTML = ''; logs.forEach(log => { const row = document.createElement('tr'); row.innerHTML = ` <td>${log.id}</td> <td>${log.sentence || log.text || 'N/A'}</td> <td><audio controls src="/audio/${log.filename}"></audio></td> <td>${new Date(log.timestamp).toLocaleString()}</td> <td><button class="delete-button" data-id="${log.id}">Delete</button></td> `; logsTableBody.appendChild(row); }); document.querySelectorAll('.delete-button').forEach(button => { button.addEventListener('click', () => { const logId = button.dataset.id; deleteModal.style.display = 'flex'; confirmDeleteBtn.onclick = () => deleteLog(logId); cancelDeleteBtn.onclick = () => (deleteModal.style.display = 'none'); }); }); } catch (error) { console.error('Error loading logs:', error); } } // Delete log async function deleteLog(logId) { try { const response = await fetch(`/context-audio-recording/delete/${logId}`, { method: 'DELETE' }); if (response.ok) { deleteModal.style.display = 'none'; loadLogs(); } } catch (error) { console.error('Error deleting log:', error); } } // Initial load loadLogs(); });

Notes:

  • Adjusted to handle both sentence and text in the logs table for compatibility with existing transcription data.
  • No other significant changes needed.

backend/main.py

Ensure the router is included:

backend/main.py:

python
from fastapi import FastAPI from fastapi.staticfiles import StaticFiles from backend.routes import record # Assuming other routes (e.g., live transcription) are in separate files app = FastAPI() app.include_router(record.router) app.mount("/static", StaticFiles(directory="static"), name="static") app.mount("/audio", StaticFiles(directory="audio"), name="audio")

Step 3: Set Up and Test

  1. Verify Database:
    • Ensure audio_logs.db exists and the logs table has the sentence column. If not, run the updated database.py to create it.
  2. Place Files:
    • Save the updated files in their respective directories.
    • Move audio_context_record.js to static/.
  3. Run the Server:
    bash
    cd C:\CetLocal\1_Artificial intelligence\Projects\Personal-AI-Logger uvicorn backend.main:app --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8000 --reload
  4. Test:
    • Access http://192.168.1.100:8000/context-audio-recording.
    • Generate a sentence, record, save, and check the logs table.
    • Verify compatibility with existing transcription logs (if any) by visiting http://192.168.1.100:8000/live-transcription.
  5. Debug:
    • Method Mismatch: If log.py methods differ (e.g., different parameter names), update the calls in record.py.
    • Database Errors: Check for schema mismatches; adjust the Log model if needed.
    • File Paths: Ensure the audio/ directory is writable.

Additional Notes

  • log.py Integration: If your log.py has additional methods or a different structure (e.g., uses a different table name), share it, and I’ll adjust the code.
  • Existing Data: The updated get_audio_logs prioritizes sentence over text, so existing transcription logs will display text if sentence is null.
  • Next Steps: Once tested, let me know if you need AI-generated sentences or further enhancements!

Please provide your log.py or confirm the method names if they differ, and I’ll refine the solution!

let's do it step by step: the record.py will have endpoints for this new features let's create the audio-context-record endpoint

Let’s implement the /context-audio-recording endpoint step-by-step, focusing first on creating the endpoint in record.py. Since we’re building on your existing project, we’ll ensure compatibility with the old database and predefined methods in log.py. We’ll also set up the endpoint to serve the audio_context_record.html page and handle the required functionality (generate sentences, record audio, and store in the logs table).

Step 1: Understand the Requirements

The /context-audio-recording endpoint should:

  • Serve the audio_context_record.html page for the frontend.
  • Provide additional endpoints for:
    • Generating a sentence for the user to read.
    • Saving the recorded audio and associated metadata (sentence, timestamp) to the logs table.
    • Fetching logs for display.
    • Deleting logs (including the audio file).

We’ll use the existing database (audio_logs.db) and methods from log.py (assumed to contain add_log, get_logs, and delete_log as previously inferred). The record.py file will define these endpoints using FastAPI.

Step 2: Set Up record.py

We’ll create backend/routes/record.py to define the /context-audio-recording endpoint and its related routes. We’ll also ensure it integrates with log.py for database operations.

backend/routes/record.py

python
from fastapi import APIRouter, UploadFile, Form, HTTPException from fastapi.responses import HTMLResponse, JSONResponse from fastapi.templating import Jinja2Templates from fastapi.requests import Request from backend.log import add_log, get_logs, delete_log # Import predefined methods from backend.database import get_db, Log # Import database dependencies from pathlib import Path import uuid import shutil import os import random router = APIRouter() # Set up templates (assuming templates are in the 'frontend' directory) templates = Jinja2Templates(directory="frontend") # List of predefined sentences (for now; can be replaced with AI-generated sentences) sentences = [ "The spaceship hovered silently above the alien planet.", "A mysterious signal came from the edge of the galaxy.", "The robot repaired the damaged starship in record time.", "Green lights flickered in the distant nebula.", "The captain ordered a course change to avoid the asteroid field." ] # Serve the audio_context_record.html page @router.get("/context-audio-recording", response_class=HTMLResponse) async def get_audio_context_record(request: Request): return templates.TemplateResponse("audio_context_record.html", {"request": request}) # Generate a random sentence @router.get("/context-audio-recording/generate-sentence") async def generate_sentence(): try: sentence = random.choice(sentences) return JSONResponse({"sentence": sentence}) except Exception as e: raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e)) # Save the audio recording @router.post("/context-audio-recording/save") async def save_audio_recording(audio: UploadFile, sentence: str = Form(...), timestamp: str = Form(...)): try: # Generate a unique filename filename = f"{uuid.uuid4()}.wav" file_path = Path("audio") / filename # Ensure the audio directory exists file_path.parent.mkdir(exist_ok=True) # Save the audio file with open(file_path, "wb") as buffer: shutil.copyfileobj(audio.file, buffer) # Save to logs table using log.py db = next(get_db()) log_id = add_log(db, sentence=sentence, filename=filename, timestamp=timestamp) return JSONResponse({"message": "Recording saved", "id": log_id}) except Exception as e: raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e)) # Fetch all logs @router.get("/context-audio-recording/logs") async def get_audio_logs(): try: db = next(get_db()) logs = get_logs(db) return [ { "id": log.id, "sentence": log.sentence if log.sentence else log.text, # Use sentence or text "filename": log.filename, "timestamp": log.timestamp.isoformat() if log.timestamp else None } for log in logs ] except Exception as e: raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e)) # Delete a log @router.delete("/context-audio-recording/delete/{log_id}") async def delete_audio_log(log_id: int): try: db = next(get_db()) log = db.query(Log).filter(Log.id == log_id).first() if log and delete_log(db, log_id): file_path = Path("audio") / log.filename if file_path.exists(): os.remove(file_path) return JSONResponse({"message": "Log deleted"}) raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Log not found") except Exception as e: raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e))

Notes:

  • GET /context-audio-recording: Serves the audio_context_record.html page using Jinja2 templates.
  • GET /context-audio-recording/generate-sentence: Returns a random sentence for the user to read (can be extended to use AI-generated sentences later).
  • POST /context-audio-recording/save: Saves the audio file to the audio/ directory and logs the metadata using add_log from log.py.
  • GET /context-audio-recording/logs: Retrieves all logs, prioritizing sentence over text for display.
  • DELETE /context-audio-recording/delete/{log_id}: Deletes a log and its associated audio file using delete_log from log.py.

Dependencies

Ensure the following are set up in your project:

  • Jinja2: Install if not already present:
    bash
    pip install Jinja2
  • Static Files: The audio/ and static/ directories should be mounted in main.py (assumed from previous context):
    python
    from fastapi.staticfiles import StaticFiles app = FastAPI() app.mount("/static", StaticFiles(directory="static"), name="static") app.mount("/audio", StaticFiles(directory="audio"), name="audio") app.include_router(record.router)

Step 3: Update main.py

Ensure the record.py router is included in your FastAPI app.

backend/main.py:

python
from fastapi import FastAPI from fastapi.staticfiles import StaticFiles from backend.routes import record # Include other routers as needed app = FastAPI() # Mount static directories app.mount("/static", StaticFiles(directory="static"), name="static") app.mount("/audio", StaticFiles(directory="audio"), name="audio") # Include routers app.include_router(record.router)

Notes:

  • If you have other routers (e.g., for live transcription), ensure they’re included here as well.

Step 4: Test the Endpoint

  1. Create the audio/ Directory:
    • Ensure the audio/ directory exists in your project root (C:\CetLocal\1_Artificial intelligence\Projects\Personal-AI-Logger\audio).
  2. Run the Server:
    bash
    cd C:\CetLocal\1_Artificial intelligence\Projects\Personal-AI-Logger uvicorn backend.main:app --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8000 --reload
  3. Access the Endpoint:
    • Open http://192.168.1.100:8000/context-audio-recording on your phone or desktop.
    • You should see the audio_context_record.html page (though we haven’t fully implemented its functionality yet). If the page doesn’t load, ensure audio_context_record.html exists in frontend/.
  4. Test API Endpoints:
    • Generate Sentence:
      • GET http://192.168.1.100:8000/context-audio-recording/generate-sentence
      • Expected response: {"sentence": "Some random sentence..."}
    • Save Recording (Test via a tool like Postman):
      • POST http://192.168.1.100:8000/context-audio-recording/save
      • Body: Form-data with audio (upload a .wav file), sentence (e.g., "Test sentence"), timestamp (e.g., 2025-03-17T12:00:00Z).
      • Expected response: {"message": "Recording saved", "id": 1}
    • Get Logs:
      • GET http://192.168.1.100:8000/context-audio-recording/logs
      • Expected response: Array of log entries.
    • Delete Log:
      • DELETE http://192.168.1.100:8000/context-audio-recording/delete/1
      • Expected response: {"message": "Log deleted"}

Step 5: Debug

  • Template Not Found: Ensure audio_context_record.html is in frontend/, and Jinja2 is installed.
  • log.py Errors: If add_log, get_logs, or delete_log don’t exist or have different signatures, you’ll need to adjust the calls. Share your log.py if this happens.
  • File Storage: Verify the audio/ directory is writable and correctly mounted.
  • Database Issues: Ensure the logs table in audio_logs.db has the sentence column (from the previous step).

Next Steps

In the next step, we’ll implement audio_context_record.html and audio_context_record.js to create the frontend for recording, displaying the sentence, and interacting with these endpoints. Let me know if you’d like to proceed to that, or if you need adjustments to record.py first (e.g., if log.py methods differ)!

Would you like to share your log.py file to confirm the method signatures, or should we move to the frontend implementation?

sorry my fault, the audio-context-recording should be in the main.py from fastapi import FastAPI from fastapi.middleware.cors import CORSMiddleware from fastapi.responses import HTMLResponse from fastapi.staticfiles import StaticFiles from backend.database import AsyncSessionLocal import os from backend.api.routes import log, search, transcribe import uvicorn import logging from backend.database import check_permissions # Create app app = FastAPI() app.add_middleware( CORSMiddleware, allow_origins=["*"], allow_credentials=True, allow_methods=["*"], allow_headers=["*"], ) logger = logging.getLogger(__name__) @app.on_event("startup") async def startup_event(): logger.debug("Registered routes:") async with AsyncSessionLocal() as session: await check_permissions(db=session) for route in app.routes: logger.debug(f"{route.path} [{route.name}]") logger.info(f"{route.path} [{route.name}]") # Mount the static files directory frontend_path = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), "..", "frontend") app.mount("/static", StaticFiles(directory=frontend_path), name="static") @app.get("/", response_class=HTMLResponse) async def read_root(): html_file_path = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), "..", "frontend", "index.html") try: with open(html_file_path, "r") as f: return f.read() except Exception as e: logger.error(f"Error reading index.html: {e}") return HTMLResponse(content="Error loading page", status_code=500) @app.get("/live-transcription", response_class=HTMLResponse) def live_transcription(): html_file_path = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), "..", "frontend", "live_transcription.html") try: with open(html_file_path, "r") as f: html_content = f.read() # Replace the direct scripts.js reference with the static path html_content = html_content.replace('src="live_transcription.js"', 'src="/static/live_transcription.js"') return html_content except Exception as e: logger.error(f"Error reading index.html: {e}") return HTMLResponse(content="Error loading page", status_code=500) app.include_router(log.router, prefix='/api') app.include_router(search.router, prefix='/api') app.include_router(transcribe.router, prefix='/api') if __name__ == "__main__": uvicorn.run("backend.main:app", host="127.0.0.1", port=8000, reload=True, log_level="debug")

No problem at all! Thank you for sharing your main.py file. I see that the existing endpoints (e.g., /, /live-transcription, and API routes under /api) are defined directly in main.py, and the routing for other features (e.g., log, search, transcribe) is handled via included routers with a /api prefix. Given this structure, we’ll add the /context-audio-recording endpoint directly to main.py instead of creating a separate record.py router, aligning with your current setup.

We’ll implement the endpoint to:

  • Serve the audio_context_record.html page.
  • Provide sub-endpoints for generating sentences, saving recordings, fetching logs, and deleting logs.
  • Integrate with the existing AsyncSessionLocal and log.py methods (assuming they exist and are compatible).

Let’s proceed step-by-step.

Step 1: Update main.py with the /context-audio-recording Endpoint

We’ll add the new endpoint logic directly into main.py, using the existing database session (AsyncSessionLocal) and ensuring compatibility with your project’s structure.

Updated backend/main.py

python
from fastapi import FastAPI, UploadFile, Form, HTTPException from fastapi.middleware.cors import CORSMiddleware from fastapi.responses import HTMLResponse, JSONResponse from fastapi.staticfiles import StaticFiles from backend.database import AsyncSessionLocal, check_permissions import os from backend.api.routes import log, search, transcribe import uvicorn import logging from pathlib import Path import uuid import shutil import random import asyncio # Create app app = FastAPI() app.add_middleware( CORSMiddleware, allow_origins=["*"], allow_credentials=True, allow_methods=["*"], allow_headers=["*"], ) logger = logging.getLogger(__name__) @app.on_event("startup") async def startup_event(): logger.debug("Registered routes:") async with AsyncSessionLocal() as session: await check_permissions(db=session) for route in app.routes: logger.debug(f"{route.path} [{route.name}]") logger.info(f"{route.path} [{route.name}]") # Mount the static files directory frontend_path = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), "..", "frontend") app.mount("/static", StaticFiles(directory=frontend_path), name="static") @app.get("/", response_class=HTMLResponse) async def read_root(): html_file_path = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), "..", "frontend", "index.html") try: with open(html_file_path, "r") as f: return f.read() except Exception as e: logger.error(f"Error reading index.html: {e}") return HTMLResponse(content="Error loading page", status_code=500) @app.get("/live-transcription", response_class=HTMLResponse) def live_transcription(): html_file_path = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), "..", "frontend", "live_transcription.html") try: with open(html_file_path, "r") as f: html_content = f.read() # Replace the direct scripts.js reference with the static path html_content = html_content.replace('src="live_transcription.js"', 'src="/static/live_transcription.js"') return html_content except Exception as e: logger.error(f"Error reading live_transcription.html: {e}") return HTMLResponse(content="Error loading page", status_code=500) # New context-audio-recording endpoints @app.get("/context-audio-recording", response_class=HTMLResponse) async def context_audio_recording(): html_file_path = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), "..", "frontend", "audio_context_record.html") try: with open(html_file_path, "r") as f: html_content = f.read() # Replace the direct JS reference with the static path html_content = html_content.replace('src="/audio_context_record.js"', 'src="/static/audio_context_record.js"') return html_content except Exception as e: logger.error(f"Error reading audio_context_record.html: {e}") return HTMLResponse(content="Error loading page", status_code=500) @app.get("/context-audio-recording/generate-sentence") async def generate_sentence(): try: # List of predefined sentences (can be replaced with AI generation later) sentences = [ "The spaceship hovered silently above the alien planet.", "A mysterious signal came from the edge of the galaxy.", "The robot repaired the damaged starship in record time.", "Green lights flickered in the distant nebula.", "The captain ordered a course change to avoid the asteroid field." ] sentence = random.choice(sentences) return JSONResponse({"sentence": sentence}) except Exception as e: raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e)) @app.post("/context-audio-recording/save") async def save_audio_recording(audio: UploadFile, sentence: str = Form(...), timestamp: str = Form(...)): try: # Generate a unique filename filename = f"{uuid.uuid4()}.wav" file_path = Path("audio") / filename # Ensure the audio directory exists file_path.parent.mkdir(exist_ok=True) # Save the audio file async with AsyncSessionLocal() as session: with open(file_path, "wb") as buffer: shutil.copyfileobj(audio.file, buffer) # Assuming log.py has an async add_log method; adjust if synchronous from backend.api.routes.log import add_log # Adjust import based on your structure log_id = await add_log(session, sentence=sentence, filename=filename, timestamp=timestamp) return JSONResponse({"message": "Recording saved", "id": log_id}) except Exception as e: raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e)) @app.get("/context-audio-recording/logs") async def get_audio_logs(): try: async with AsyncSessionLocal() as session: from backend.api.routes.log import get_logs # Adjust import based on your structure logs = await get_logs(session) return [ { "id": log.id, "sentence": log.sentence if log.sentence else log.text, "filename": log.filename, "timestamp": log.timestamp.isoformat() if log.timestamp else None } for log in logs ] except Exception as e: raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e)) @app.delete("/context-audio-recording/delete/{log_id}") async def delete_audio_log(log_id: int): try: async with AsyncSessionLocal() as session: from backend.api.routes.log import delete_log # Adjust import based on your structure from backend.database import Log log = await session.get(Log, log_id) if log and await delete_log(session, log_id): file_path = Path("audio") / log.filename if file_path.exists(): os.remove(file_path) return JSONResponse({"message": "Log deleted"}) raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Log not found") except Exception as e: raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e)) # Include existing API routers app.include_router(log.router, prefix='/api') app.include_router(search.router, prefix='/api') app.include_router(transcribe.router, prefix='/api') if __name__ == "__main__": uvicorn.run("backend.main:app", host="127.0.0.1", port=8000, reload=True, log_level="debug")

Changes and Notes:

  • Added /context-audio-recording Endpoint:
    • Serves audio_context_record.html with a static path replacement for the JS file.
  • Added Sub-Endpoints:
    • GET /context-audio-recording/generate-sentence: Returns a random sentence.
    • POST /context-audio-recording/save: Saves the audio file and logs the metadata.
    • GET /context-audio-recording/logs: Fetches all logs.
    • DELETE /context-audio-recording/delete/{log_id}: Deletes a log and its audio file.
  • Database Integration:
    • Uses AsyncSessionLocal for asynchronous database operations.
    • Imports add_log, get_logs, and delete_log from backend.api.routes.log (adjust the import path if your log.py is located elsewhere, e.g., backend.log).
    • Assumes these methods are async; if they’re synchronous, we’ll need to adjust (let me know if they differ).
  • File Handling:
    • Saves audio files to the audio/ directory, creating it if necessary.
  • Error Handling:
    • Logs errors and returns appropriate HTTP exceptions.

Step 2: Verify Prerequisites

  • Database Model: Ensure the Log model in backend/database.py includes sentence, filename, and timestamp columns (as updated previously):
    python
    from sqlalchemy import Column, Integer, String, DateTime from sqlalchemy.ext.declarative import declarative_base Base = declarative_base() class Log(Base): __tablename__ = "logs" id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True, index=True) text = Column(String, index=True) # For live transcription sentence = Column(String, index=True) # For context recording filename = Column(String, unique=True, index=True) timestamp = Column(DateTime)
    • If this model differs, update it to match your existing schema.
  • log.py Methods: Verify that backend.api.routes.log (or wherever log.py is) contains:
    • async def add_log(session, sentence=None, filename=None, timestamp=None): Adds a log entry.
    • async def get_logs(session): Retrieves all logs.
    • async def delete_log(session, log_id): Deletes a log by ID. If these methods are in a different file or have different signatures, please share log.py, and I’ll adjust the imports and calls.
  • Directory Structure:
    • Ensure frontend/audio_context_record.html exists.
    • Move audio_context_record.js (once created) to frontend/ (it will be served as /static/audio_context_record.js).

Step 3: Test the Endpoint

  1. Create the audio/ Directory:
    • Run mkdir audio in your project root if it doesn’t exist.
  2. Run the Server:
    bash
    cd C:\CetLocal\1_Artificial intelligence\Projects\Personal-AI-Logger uvicorn backend.main:app --host 127.0.0.1 --port 8000 --reload --log-level debug
  3. Access the Endpoint:
    • Open http://127.0.0.1:8000/context-audio-recording in your browser.
    • You should see the audio_context_record.html page (if it exists). If not, you’ll get an error, and we’ll need to create it next.
  4. Test API Endpoints:
    • Generate Sentence:
      • GET http://127.0.0.1:8000/context-audio-recording/generate-sentence
      • Expected: {"sentence": "Some random sentence..."}
    • Save Recording (Test with Postman or curl):
      • POST http://127.0.0.1:8000/context-audio-recording/save
      • Body: Form-data with audio (upload a .wav file), sentence (e.g., "Test sentence"), timestamp (e.g., 2025-03-17T12:00:00Z).
      • Expected: {"message": "Recording saved", "id": 1}
    • Get Logs:
      • GET http://127.0.0.1:8000/context-audio-recording/logs
      • Expected: Array of log entries.
    • Delete Log:
      • DELETE http://127.0.0.1:8000/context-audio-recording/delete/1
      • Expected: {"message": "Log deleted"}

Step 4: Debug

  • Template Error: If audio_context_record.html is missing, you’ll get a 500 error. We’ll create it in the next step.
  • log.py Import Issues: If the import from backend.api.routes.log fails, check the location of log.py and adjust the import (e.g., from backend.log).
  • Async/Sync Mismatch: If log.py methods are synchronous, wrap them in asyncio.to_thread() or convert them to async (let me know your log.py content).
  • File Permissions: Ensure the audio/ directory is writable.

Next Steps

The /context-audio-recording endpoint is now defined in main.py. In the next step, we’ll:

  1. Create frontend/audio_context_record.html to display the UI.
  2. Create frontend/audio_context_record.js to handle recording and interact with the endpoints.

Would you like to proceed to the frontend implementation, or do you need to adjust anything in main.py first (e.g., share log.py for verification)?

document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', () => { const generateSentenceBtn = document.getElementById('generateSentence'); const startRecordingBtn = document.getElementById('startRecording'); const stopRecordingBtn = document.getElementById('stopRecording'); const saveRecordingBtn = document.getElementById('saveRecording'); const showLogsBtn = document.getElementById('showLogsButton'); const sentenceDiv = document.getElementById('sentence'); const recordingStatus = document.getElementById('recordingStatus'); const logsTableBody = document.getElementById('logsTableBody'); const deleteModal = document.getElementById('deleteModal'); const confirmDeleteBtn = document.getElementById('confirmDelete'); const cancelDeleteBtn = document.getElementById('cancelDelete'); let mediaRecorder; let audioChunks = []; let currentSentence = ''; // Generate a random sentence const sentences = [ "The spaceship hovered silently above the alien planet.", "A mysterious signal came from the edge of the galaxy.", "The robot repaired the damaged starship in record time.", "Green lights flickered in the distant nebula.", "The captain ordered a course change to avoid the asteroid field." ]; generateSentenceBtn.addEventListener('click', () => { currentSentence = sentences[Math.floor(Math.random() * sentences.length)]; sentenceDiv.textContent = currentSentence; startRecordingBtn.disabled = false; recordingStatus.textContent = 'Ready to record.'; }); // Request microphone access and start recording startRecordingBtn.addEventListener('click', async () => { try { const stream = await navigator.mediaDevices.getUserMedia({ audio: true }); mediaRecorder = new MediaRecorder(stream); audioChunks = []; mediaRecorder.ondataavailable = (event) => { audioChunks.push(event.data); }; mediaRecorder.onstop = () => { const audioBlob = new Blob(audioChunks, { type: 'audio/wav' }); const audioUrl = URL.createObjectURL(audioBlob); saveRecordingBtn.disabled = false; saveRecordingBtn.dataset.audioBlob = audioBlob; // Store blob for saving recordingStatus.textContent = 'Recording stopped. Click "Save" to store.'; }; mediaRecorder.start(); startRecordingBtn.disabled = true; stopRecordingBtn.disabled = false; recordingStatus.textContent = 'Recording...'; } catch (error) { recordingStatus.textContent = `Error accessing microphone: ${error.message}`; } }); // Stop recording stopRecordingBtn.addEventListener('click', () => { if (mediaRecorder && mediaRecorder.state === 'recording') { mediaRecorder.stop(); stopRecordingBtn.disabled = true; } }); // Save recording to server saveRecordingBtn.addEventListener('click', async () => { const audioBlob = saveRecordingBtn.dataset.audioBlob; if (!audioBlob || !currentSentence) { recordingStatus.textContent = 'No recording or sentence to save.'; return; } const formData = new FormData(); formData.append('audio', audioBlob, 'recording.wav'); formData.append('sentence', currentSentence); formData.append('timestamp', new Date().toISOString()); try { const response = await fetch('/context-audio-recording/save', { method: 'POST', body: formData });
