const data = await response.json(); if (response.ok) { recordingStatus.textContent = 'Recording saved successfully!'; loadLogs(); startRecordingBtn.disabled = false; saveRecordingBtn.disabled = true; delete saveRecordingBtn.dataset.audioBlob; } else { recordingStatus.textContent = `Error: ${data.detail}`; } } catch (error) { recordingStatus.textContent = `Error saving recording: ${error.message}`; } }); // Show logs showLogsBtn.addEventListener('click', () => { loadLogs(); }); // Load logs from server async function loadLogs() { try { const response = await fetch('/context-audio-recording/logs'); const logs = await response.json(); logsTableBody.innerHTML = ''; logs.forEach(log => { const row = document.createElement('tr'); row.innerHTML = ` <td>${log.id}</td> <td>${log.sentence}</td> <td><audio controls src="/audio/${log.filename}"></audio></td> <td>${new Date(log.timestamp).toLocaleString()}</td> <td><button class="delete-button" data-id="${log.id}">Delete</button></td> `; logsTableBody.appendChild(row); }); // Add delete event listeners document.querySelectorAll('.delete-button').forEach(button => { button.addEventListener('click', () => { const logId = button.dataset.id; deleteModal.style.display = 'flex'; confirmDeleteBtn.onclick = () => deleteLog(logId); cancelDeleteBtn.onclick = () => (deleteModal.style.display = 'none'); }); }); } catch (error) { console.error('Error loading logs:', error); } } // Delete log async function deleteLog(logId) { try { const response = await fetch(`/context-audio-recording/delete/${logId}`, { method: 'DELETE' }); if (response.ok) { deleteModal.style.display = 'none'; loadLogs(); } } catch (error) { console.error('Error deleting log:', error); } } // Initial load loadLogs(); }); adapt this code to make it similar to this class TranscriptionHandler { constructor() { // Initialize buttons this.startButton = document.getElementById("startButton"); this.pauseButton = document.getElementById("pauseButton"); this.saveButton = document.getElementById("saveButton"); this.clearButton = document.getElementById("clearButton"); this.transcriptionDiv = document.getElementById("transcription"); this.statusDiv = document.getElementById("status"); this.logsTableContainer = document.getElementById("logsTableContainer"); this.logsTableBody = document.getElementById("logsTableBody"); this.showLogsButton = document.getElementById("showLogsButton"); // Initialize state this.socket = null; this.recorder = null; this.stream = null; this.audioContext = null; this.audioData = []; this.fullAudioData = []; this.isPaused = false; this.fullTranscript = ""; this.deleteModal = document.getElementById("deleteModal"); this.confirmDeleteBtn = document.getElementById("confirmDelete"); this.cancelDeleteBtn = document.getElementById("cancelDelete"); this.logIdToDelete = null; // Bind event listeners this.startButton.addEventListener("click", () => this.toggleTranscription()); this.pauseButton.addEventListener("click", () => this.togglePause()); this.saveButton.addEventListener("click", () => this.saveTranscript()); this.clearButton.addEventListener("click", () => this.clearTranscript()); this.showLogsButton.addEventListener("click", () => this.showLogs()); this.showLogs(); this.updateStatus("Ready"); this.updateButtonStates(false); } async showLogs() { try { this.updateStatus("Fetching logs..."); const limit = 10; const response = await fetch(`/api/logs/data?limit=${limit}`, { method: 'GET' }); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error('Failed to fetch logs'); } const logs = await response.json(); console.log("Fetched logs:", logs); this.logsTableBody.innerHTML = ''; if (logs.length === 0) { const row = document.createElement('tr'); row.innerHTML = `<td colspan="5">No logs found</td>`; this.logsTableBody.appendChild(row); } else { logs.forEach(log => { const filename = log.audio_file; const audioUrl = `/api/audio/${filename}`; const row = document.createElement('tr'); row.innerHTML = ` <td>${log.id}</td> <td>${log.text}</td> <td><audio controls src="${audioUrl}"></audio></td> <td>${new Date(log.timestamp).toLocaleString()}</td> <td></td> <!-- Placeholder for delete button --> `; const deleteButton = document.createElement('button'); deleteButton.className = 'delete-button'; deleteButton.textContent = 'Delete'; deleteButton.addEventListener('click', () => this.showDeleteConfirmation(log.id)); row.children[4].appendChild(deleteButton); // Append to the Action column this.logsTableBody.appendChild(row); }); } this.updateStatus("Logs loaded successfully"); } catch (error) { console.error("Error fetching logs:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error fetching logs: ${error.message}`); this.logsTableBody.innerHTML = `<tr><td colspan="5">Error loading logs</td></tr>`; } } showDeleteConfirmation(logId) { this.logIdToDelete = logId; this.deleteModal.style.display = 'flex'; } async confirmDelete() { if (this.logIdToDelete) { try { this.updateStatus("Deleting log..."); const response = await fetch(`/api/logs/delete/${this.logIdToDelete}`, { method: 'DELETE' }); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error('Failed to delete log'); } this.updateStatus("Log deleted successfully"); this.deleteModal.style.display = 'none'; this.showLogs(); // Refresh the logs table } catch (error) { console.error("Error deleting log:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error deleting log: ${error.message}`); } } } cancelDelete() { this.deleteModal.style.display = 'none'; this.logIdToDelete = null; } async toggleTranscription() { // Check if we're currently recording (based on recorder state or WebSocket connection) if (this.recorder?.state === "recording" || (this.socket && this.socket.readyState === WebSocket.OPEN)) { await this.stopTranscription(); } else { await this.startTranscription(); } } async startTranscription() { try { if (!navigator.mediaDevices) throw new Error("MediaDevices API not available"); const constraints = { audio: { sampleRate: 16000, channelCount: 1, echoCancellation: true, noiseSuppression: true } }; this.stream = await navigator.mediaDevices.getUserMedia(constraints); this.updateStatus("Microphone access granted"); this.audioContext = new (window.AudioContext || window.webkitAudioContext)({ sampleRate: 16000 }); const source = this.audioContext.createMediaStreamSource(this.stream); const processor = this.audioContext.createScriptProcessor(4096, 1, 1); source.connect(processor); processor.connect(this.audioContext.destination); const wsUrl = `ws://${window.location.hostname}:8000/api/transcribe`; this.socket = new WebSocket(wsUrl); this.socket.onopen = () => { this.initializeRecorder(); this.updateStatus("Connected to server"); }; this.socket.onmessage = (event) => { const data = JSON.parse(event.data); if (data.transcription) { this.fullTranscript += " " + data.transcription; this.transcriptionDiv.innerText = this.fullTranscript; this.updateButtonStates(true); } else if (data.error) { this.updateStatus(`Error: ${data.error}`); } }; this.socket.onerror = () => { this.updateStatus("WebSocket connection failed"); this.stopTranscription(); }; this.socket.onclose = () => { console.log("WebSocket closed"); this.updateStatus("Disconnected from server"); this.stopTranscription(); }; processor.onaudioprocess = (e) => { if (!this.isPaused) { this.audioData.push(...e.inputBuffer.getChannelData(0)); this.fullAudioData.push(...e.inputBuffer.getChannelData(0)); // sendWavChunk when the buffer size is > 24000. With sampling_rate = 16000 // this sends audio every 1.5 if (this.audioData.length >= 24000) this.sendWavChunk(); } }; this.updateButtonStates(true); } catch (error) { console.error("Error:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error: ${error.message}`); // await this.stopTranscription(); } } sendWavChunk() { if (this.audioData.length < 24000 || this.socket.readyState !== WebSocket.OPEN) return; const buffer = new Float32Array(this.audioData.splice(0, 24000)); this.socket.send(buffer.buffer); // Send ArrayBuffer (raw float32 bytes) } encodeWav(samples, sampleRate) { const buffer = new ArrayBuffer(44 + samples.length * 2); const view = new DataView(buffer); const writeString = (offset, string) => { for (let i = 0; i < string.length; i++) view.setUint8(offset + i, string.charCodeAt(i)); }; writeString(0, 'RIFF'); view.setUint32(4, 36 + samples.length * 2, true); writeString(8, 'WAVE'); writeString(12, 'fmt '); view.setUint32(16, 16, true); view.setUint16(20, 1, true); view.setUint16(22, 1, true); view.setUint32(24, sampleRate, true); view.setUint32(28, sampleRate * 2, true); view.setUint16(32, 2, true); view.setUint16(34, 16, true); writeString(36, 'data'); view.setUint32(40, samples.length * 2, true); for (let i = 0; i < samples.length; i++) { const s = Math.max(-1, Math.min(1, samples[i])); view.setInt16(44 + i * 2, s < 0 ? s * 0x8000 : s * 0x7FFF, true); } return buffer; } initializeRecorder() { try { if (!this.stream || !this.stream.active) throw new Error("Audio stream inactive"); this.recorder = new MediaRecorder(this.stream); this.recorder.ondataavailable = (event) => { if (this.socket?.readyState === WebSocket.OPEN && event.data.size > 0 && !this.isPaused) { this.socket.send(event.data); } }; this.recorder.start(1000); this.startButton.innerText = "Stop Transcription"; this.updateStatus("Recording started"); } catch (error) { console.error("Recorder error:", error); this.updateStatus(`Recorder error: ${error.message}`); this.stopTranscription(); } } async togglePause() { if (!this.recorder) return; this.isPaused = !this.isPaused; if (this.isPaused) { this.recorder.pause(); this.pauseButton.textContent = "Resume"; this.updateStatus("Paused"); } else { this.recorder.resume(); this.pauseButton.textContent = "Pause"; this.updateStatus("Recording"); } } async saveTranscript() { try { // Create WAV blob from accumulated audio data const wavBlob = new Blob([this.encodeWav(new Float32Array(this.fullAudioData), 16000)], { type: 'audio/wav' }); // Create unique filename with timestamp const timestamp = new Date().toISOString().replace(/[:.]/g, '-'); // this frontend filename is just a recommended name, and isn't required for the backend to save the file const filename = `recording_${timestamp}.wav`; // Create FormData with both audio and text const formData = new FormData(); formData.append('file', wavBlob, filename); //the third argument tis optional formData.append('text', this.fullTranscript.trim()); const response = await fetch('/api/logs/audio', { method: 'POST', body: formData }); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error('Failed to save transcript and audio'); } const result = await response.json(); // This is new!! this.clearTranscript(); this.showLogs(); this.updateStatus(`Saved: ${result.file_name} - Transcript cleared`); } catch (error) { console.error("Error saving:", error); this.updateStatus("Error saving transcript and audio"); } } clearTranscript() { this.fullTranscript = ""; this.audioData = [] this.fullAudioData = [] this.transcriptionDiv.innerText = "Waiting for transcription..."; this.updateButtonStates(this.recorder?.state === "recording"); } async stopTranscription() { try { console.log("Stopping transcription, audioContext state:", this.audioContext?.state); if (this.socket && this.socket.readyState === WebSocket.OPEN) { this.socket.close(1000, "Manual stop by client"); // Explicitly close } if (this.audioContext && this.audioContext.state !== 'closed') { await this.audioContext.close(); } if (this.stream) { this.stream.getTracks().forEach(track => track.stop()); this.stream = null; } // Reset all properties this.socket = null; this.updateButtonStates(false); this.updateStatus("Transcription stopped"); } catch (error) { console.error("Stop error:", error); this.updateStatus(`Stop error: ${error.message}`); } } updateButtonStates(isRecording) { this.pauseButton.disabled = !isRecording; this.saveButton.disabled = !this.fullTranscript; this.clearButton.disabled = !this.fullTranscript; this.startButton.textContent = isRecording ? "Stop Transcription" : "Start Transcription"; } updateStatus(message) { this.statusDiv.textContent = message; console.log("Status:", message); } } window.transcriptionHandler = new TranscriptionHandler(); // Add event listeners for modal buttons document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', () => { const transcriptionHandler = window.transcriptionHandler; transcriptionHandler.confirmDeleteBtn.addEventListener('click', () => transcriptionHandler.confirmDelete()); transcriptionHandler.cancelDeleteBtn.addEventListener('click', () => transcriptionHandler.cancelDelete()); });

Let’s adapt the audio_context_record.js code to follow the class-based structure of TranscriptionHandler from your provided example, ensuring consistency in design and functionality. The new implementation will:

  • Use a class (RecordingHandler) to manage the audio recording, sentence generation, and log handling.
  • Follow a similar pattern with methods like updateStatus, updateButtonStates, and showLogs.
  • Integrate with the /context-audio-recording endpoints defined in main.py.
  • Maintain the existing functionality (generate sentence, record audio, save to logs, display logs, delete logs).

Here’s the adapted version of frontend/audio_context_record.js.

Updated frontend/audio_context_record.js

javascript
class RecordingHandler { constructor() { // Initialize DOM elements this.generateSentenceBtn = document.getElementById("generateSentence"); this.startRecordingBtn = document.getElementById("startRecording"); this.stopRecordingBtn = document.getElementById("stopRecording"); this.saveRecordingBtn = document.getElementById("saveRecording"); this.showLogsBtn = document.getElementById("showLogsButton"); this.sentenceDiv = document.getElementById("sentence"); this.recordingStatus = document.getElementById("recordingStatus"); this.logsTableBody = document.getElementById("logsTableBody"); this.deleteModal = document.getElementById("deleteModal"); this.confirmDeleteBtn = document.getElementById("confirmDelete"); this.cancelDeleteBtn = document.getElementById("cancelDelete"); // Initialize state this.mediaRecorder = null; this.audioChunks = []; this.currentSentence = ""; this.logIdToDelete = null; // Bind event listeners this.generateSentenceBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.generateSentence()); this.startRecordingBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.startRecording()); this.stopRecordingBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.stopRecording()); this.saveRecordingBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.saveRecording()); this.showLogsBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.showLogs()); // Initial setup this.showLogs(); this.updateStatus("Click 'Generate Sentence' to start."); this.updateButtonStates(false); } // Update status message updateStatus(message) { this.recordingStatus.textContent = message; console.log("Status:", message); } // Update button states based on recording state updateButtonStates(isRecording) { this.startRecordingBtn.disabled = isRecording || !this.currentSentence; this.stopRecordingBtn.disabled = !isRecording; this.saveRecordingBtn.disabled = !this.audioChunks.length || !this.currentSentence; } // Generate a sentence by fetching from the backend async generateSentence() { try { this.updateStatus("Generating sentence..."); const response = await fetch("/context-audio-recording/generate-sentence", { method: "GET", }); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error("Failed to generate sentence"); } const data = await response.json(); this.currentSentence = data.sentence; this.sentenceDiv.textContent = this.currentSentence; this.updateStatus("Sentence generated. Ready to record."); this.updateButtonStates(false); } catch (error) { console.error("Error generating sentence:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error generating sentence: ${error.message}`); } } // Start recording audio async startRecording() { try { if (!navigator.mediaDevices) throw new Error("MediaDevices API not available"); const stream = await navigator.mediaDevices.getUserMedia({ audio: true }); this.mediaRecorder = new MediaRecorder(stream); this.audioChunks = []; this.mediaRecorder.ondataavailable = (event) => { this.audioChunks.push(event.data); }; this.mediaRecorder.onstop = () => { this.updateStatus("Recording stopped. Click 'Save' to store."); this.updateButtonStates(false); }; this.mediaRecorder.start(); this.updateStatus("Recording..."); this.updateButtonStates(true); } catch (error) { console.error("Error starting recording:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error accessing microphone: ${error.message}`); } } // Stop recording audio stopRecording() { if (this.mediaRecorder && this.mediaRecorder.state === "recording") { this.mediaRecorder.stop(); this.mediaRecorder.stream.getTracks().forEach(track => track.stop()); this.mediaRecorder = null; } } // Save the recording to the server async saveRecording() { if (!this.audioChunks.length || !this.currentSentence) { this.updateStatus("No recording or sentence to save."); return; } try { this.updateStatus("Saving recording..."); const audioBlob = new Blob(this.audioChunks, { type: "audio/wav" }); const formData = new FormData(); formData.append("audio", audioBlob, "recording.wav"); formData.append("sentence", this.currentSentence); formData.append("timestamp", new Date().toISOString()); const response = await fetch("/context-audio-recording/save", { method: "POST", body: formData, }); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error("Failed to save recording"); } const data = await response.json(); this.updateStatus(`Recording saved successfully: ID ${data.id}`); this.audioChunks = []; this.currentSentence = ""; this.sentenceDiv.textContent = "Click 'Generate Sentence' to start."; this.showLogs(); this.updateButtonStates(false); } catch (error) { console.error("Error saving recording:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error saving recording: ${error.message}`); } } // Fetch and display logs async showLogs() { try { this.updateStatus("Fetching logs..."); const response = await fetch("/context-audio-recording/logs", { method: "GET", }); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error("Failed to fetch logs"); } const logs = await response.json(); this.logsTableBody.innerHTML = ""; if (logs.length === 0) { const row = document.createElement("tr"); row.innerHTML = `<td colspan="5">No logs found</td>`; this.logsTableBody.appendChild(row); } else { logs.forEach(log => { const row = document.createElement("tr"); row.innerHTML = ` <td>${log.id}</td> <td>${log.sentence || "N/A"}</td> <td><audio controls src="/audio/${log.filename}"></audio></td> <td>${new Date(log.timestamp).toLocaleString()}</td> <td></td> <!-- Placeholder for delete button --> `; const deleteButton = document.createElement("button"); deleteButton.className = "delete-button"; deleteButton.textContent = "Delete"; deleteButton.addEventListener("click", () => this.showDeleteConfirmation(log.id)); row.children[4].appendChild(deleteButton); this.logsTableBody.appendChild(row); }); } this.updateStatus("Logs loaded successfully"); } catch (error) { console.error("Error fetching logs:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error fetching logs: ${error.message}`); this.logsTableBody.innerHTML = `<tr><td colspan="5">Error loading logs</td></tr>`; } } // Show delete confirmation modal showDeleteConfirmation(logId) { this.logIdToDelete = logId; this.deleteModal.style.display = "flex"; } // Confirm deletion of a log async confirmDelete() { if (this.logIdToDelete) { try { this.updateStatus("Deleting log..."); const response = await fetch(`/context-audio-recording/delete/${this.logIdToDelete}`, { method: "DELETE", }); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error("Failed to delete log"); } this.updateStatus("Log deleted successfully"); this.deleteModal.style.display = "none"; this.logIdToDelete = null; this.showLogs(); } catch (error) { console.error("Error deleting log:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error deleting log: ${error.message}`); } } } // Cancel deletion cancelDelete() { this.deleteModal.style.display = "none"; this.logIdToDelete = null; } } // Instantiate the handler window.recordingHandler = new RecordingHandler(); // Add event listeners for modal buttons document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", () => { const recordingHandler = window.recordingHandler; recordingHandler.confirmDeleteBtn.addEventListener("click", () => recordingHandler.confirmDelete()); recordingHandler.cancelDeleteBtn.addEventListener("click", () => recordingHandler.cancelDelete()); });

Key Changes and Adaptations

  1. Class Structure:
    • Converted the code into a RecordingHandler class, mirroring the TranscriptionHandler structure.
    • Initialized DOM elements and state in the constructor.
    • Bound event listeners in the constructor using class methods.
  2. State Management:
    • Used instance properties (this.mediaRecorder, this.audioChunks, this.currentSentence) instead of local variables.
    • Added this.logIdToDelete for managing deletions, similar to TranscriptionHandler.
  3. Button States:
    • Added updateButtonStates(isRecording) to manage button states dynamically, similar to TranscriptionHandler.
    • Buttons are enabled/disabled based on recording state and the presence of a sentence.
  4. Status Updates:
    • Added updateStatus(message) to update the recordingStatus div, mirroring TranscriptionHandler.
  5. Sentence Generation:
    • Replaced the local sentence array with a fetch call to /context-audio-recording/generate-sentence, aligning with the backend endpoint.
    • This allows for future AI-generated sentences if desired.
  6. Recording:
    • Kept the recording logic using MediaRecorder, but organized it into startRecording and stopRecording methods.
    • Simplified audio handling (no WebSocket or audio processing like in TranscriptionHandler, since we’re not doing live transcription).
  7. Logs Display:
    • Adapted showLogs to match the style of TranscriptionHandler, including error handling and a "No logs found" message.
    • Added a delete button dynamically to each row, similar to TranscriptionHandler.
  8. Delete Confirmation:
    • Implemented showDeleteConfirmation, confirmDelete, and cancelDelete methods to manage the delete modal, mirroring TranscriptionHandler.
  9. Event Listeners:
    • Moved modal event listeners (confirmDeleteBtn, cancelDeleteBtn) outside the class, attaching them after instantiation, as done in TranscriptionHandler.

Integration with main.py

The updated audio_context_record.js integrates with the endpoints defined in main.py:

  • GET /context-audio-recording/generate-sentence: Fetches a sentence.
  • POST /context-audio-recording/save: Saves the audio and metadata.
  • GET /context-audio-recording/logs: Fetches logs.
  • DELETE /context-audio-recording/delete/{log_id}: Deletes a log.

The audio files are served from /audio/{filename}, which requires the audio/ directory to be mounted. Since main.py doesn’t currently mount the audio/ directory, we need to update it.

Update main.py to Mount audio/

backend/main.py (Updated):

python
from fastapi import FastAPI, UploadFile, Form, HTTPException from fastapi.middleware.cors import CORSMiddleware from fastapi.responses import HTMLResponse, JSONResponse from fastapi.staticfiles import StaticFiles from backend.database import AsyncSessionLocal, check_permissions import os from backend.api.routes import log, search, transcribe import uvicorn import logging from pathlib import Path import uuid import shutil import random import asyncio # Create app app = FastAPI() app.add_middleware( CORSMiddleware, allow_origins=["*"], allow_credentials=True, allow_methods=["*"], allow_headers=["*"], ) logger = logging.getLogger(__name__) @app.on_event("startup") async def startup_event(): logger.debug("Registered routes:") async with AsyncSessionLocal() as session: await check_permissions(db=session) for route in app.routes: logger.debug(f"{route.path} [{route.name}]") logger.info(f"{route.path} [{route.name}]") # Mount the static files directories frontend_path = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), "..", "frontend") app.mount("/static", StaticFiles(directory=frontend_path), name="static") app.mount("/audio", StaticFiles(directory="audio"), name="audio") # Add this line @app.get("/", response_class=HTMLResponse) async def read_root(): html_file_path = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), "..", "frontend", "index.html") try: with open(html_file_path, "r") as f: return f.read() except Exception as e: logger.error(f"Error reading index.html: {e}") return HTMLResponse(content="Error loading page", status_code=500) @app.get("/live-transcription", response_class=HTMLResponse) def live_transcription(): html_file_path = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), "..", "frontend", "live_transcription.html") try: with open(html_file_path, "r") as f: html_content = f.read() html_content = html_content.replace('src="live_transcription.js"', 'src="/static/live_transcription.js"') return html_content except Exception as e: logger.error(f"Error reading live_transcription.html: {e}") return HTMLResponse(content="Error loading page", status_code=500) @app.get("/context-audio-recording", response_class=HTMLResponse) async def context_audio_recording(): html_file_path = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), "..", "frontend", "audio_context_record.html") try: with open(html_file_path, "r") as f: html_content = f.read() html_content = html_content.replace('src="/audio_context_record.js"', 'src="/static/audio_context_record.js"') return html_content except Exception as e: logger.error(f"Error reading audio_context_record.html: {e}") return HTMLResponse(content="Error loading page", status_code=500) @app.get("/context-audio-recording/generate-sentence") async def generate_sentence(): try: sentences = [ "The spaceship hovered silently above the alien planet.", "A mysterious signal came from the edge of the galaxy.", "The robot repaired the damaged starship in record time.", "Green lights flickered in the distant nebula.", "The captain ordered a course change to avoid the asteroid field." ] sentence = random.choice(sentences) return JSONResponse({"sentence": sentence}) except Exception as e: raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e)) @app.post("/context-audio-recording/save") async def save_audio_recording(audio: UploadFile, sentence: str = Form(...), timestamp: str = Form(...)): try: filename = f"{uuid.uuid4()}.wav" file_path = Path("audio") / filename file_path.parent.mkdir(exist_ok=True) async with AsyncSessionLocal() as session: with open(file_path, "wb") as buffer: shutil.copyfileobj(audio.file, buffer) from backend.api.routes.log import add_log log_id = await add_log(session, sentence=sentence, filename=filename, timestamp=timestamp) return JSONResponse({"message": "Recording saved", "id": log_id}) except Exception as e: raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e)) @app.get("/context-audio-recording/logs") async def get_audio_logs(): try: async with AsyncSessionLocal() as session: from backend.api.routes.log import get_logs logs = await get_logs(session) return [ { "id": log.id, "sentence": log.sentence if log.sentence else log.text, "filename": log.filename, "timestamp": log.timestamp.isoformat() if log.timestamp else None } for log in logs ] except Exception as e: raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e)) @app.delete("/context-audio-recording/delete/{log_id}") async def delete_audio_log(log_id: int): try: async with AsyncSessionLocal() as session: from backend.api.routes.log import delete_log from backend.database import Log log = await session.get(Log, log_id) if log and await delete_log(session, log_id): file_path = Path("audio") / log.filename if file_path.exists(): os.remove(file_path) return JSONResponse({"message": "Log deleted"}) raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Log not found") except Exception as e: raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e)) app.include_router(log.router, prefix='/api') app.include_router(search.router, prefix='/api') app.include_router(transcribe.router, prefix='/api') if __name__ == "__main__": uvicorn.run("backend.main:app", host="127.0.0.1", port=8000, reload=True, log_level="debug")

Change:

  • Added app.mount("/audio", StaticFiles(directory="audio"), name="audio") to serve audio files.

Next Steps

The audio_context_record.js is now adapted to a class-based structure similar to TranscriptionHandler. To complete the implementation:

  1. Create audio_context_record.html: We need the HTML file with the corresponding DOM elements (generateSentence, startRecording, etc.).
  2. Test the Integration: Ensure the frontend works with the backend endpoints.

Would you like to proceed to creating audio_context_record.html, or do you need adjustments to audio_context_record.js or main.py first? Also, if you can share backend.api.routes.log (your log.py), I can confirm the method signatures for add_log, get_logs, and delete_log.

add the clear current sentence method

Let's add a method to clear the current sentence in the RecordingHandler class in audio_context_record.js. This will allow the user to reset the sentence display and related state, similar to how clearTranscript works in the TranscriptionHandler class. We'll also add a corresponding button in the UI (which we'll need to reflect in the HTML later) and ensure the method updates the state appropriately.

The clearCurrentSentence method will:

  • Reset the currentSentence to an empty string.
  • Clear the sentenceDiv display.
  • Reset the audioChunks to ensure no leftover recording data remains.
  • Update the button states and status message.

I'll update the audio_context_record.js file to include this functionality and bind a new "Clear Sentence" button.

Step 1: Update frontend/audio_context_record.js

Here’s the updated audio_context_record.js with the clearCurrentSentence method and related changes:

frontend/audio_context_record.js (Updated):

javascript
class RecordingHandler { constructor() { // Initialize DOM elements this.generateSentenceBtn = document.getElementById("generateSentence"); this.startRecordingBtn = document.getElementById("startRecording"); this.stopRecordingBtn = document.getElementById("stopRecording"); this.saveRecordingBtn = document.getElementById("saveRecording"); this.clearSentenceBtn = document.getElementById("clearSentence"); // New button this.showLogsBtn = document.getElementById("showLogsButton"); this.sentenceDiv = document.getElementById("sentence"); this.recordingStatus = document.getElementById("recordingStatus"); this.logsTableBody = document.getElementById("logsTableBody"); this.deleteModal = document.getElementById("deleteModal"); this.confirmDeleteBtn = document.getElementById("confirmDelete"); this.cancelDeleteBtn = document.getElementById("cancelDelete"); // Initialize state this.mediaRecorder = null; this.audioChunks = []; this.currentSentence = ""; this.logIdToDelete = null; // Bind event listeners this.generateSentenceBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.generateSentence()); this.startRecordingBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.startRecording()); this.stopRecordingBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.stopRecording()); this.saveRecordingBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.saveRecording()); this.clearSentenceBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.clearCurrentSentence()); // Bind new button this.showLogsBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.showLogs()); // Initial setup this.showLogs(); this.updateStatus("Click 'Generate Sentence' to start."); this.updateButtonStates(false); } // Update status message updateStatus(message) { this.recordingStatus.textContent = message; console.log("Status:", message); } // Update button states based on recording state updateButtonStates(isRecording) { this.startRecordingBtn.disabled = isRecording || !this.currentSentence; this.stopRecordingBtn.disabled = !isRecording; this.saveRecordingBtn.disabled = !this.audioChunks.length || !this.currentSentence; this.clearSentenceBtn.disabled = !this.currentSentence; // Disable if no sentence to clear } // Generate a sentence by fetching from the backend async generateSentence() { try { this.updateStatus("Generating sentence..."); const response = await fetch("/context-audio-recording/generate-sentence", { method: "GET", }); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error("Failed to generate sentence"); } const data = await response.json(); this.currentSentence = data.sentence; this.sentenceDiv.textContent = this.currentSentence; this.updateStatus("Sentence generated. Ready to record."); this.updateButtonStates(false); } catch (error) { console.error("Error generating sentence:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error generating sentence: ${error.message}`); } } // Start recording audio async startRecording() { try { if (!navigator.mediaDevices) throw new Error("MediaDevices API not available"); const stream = await navigator.mediaDevices.getUserMedia({ audio: true }); this.mediaRecorder = new MediaRecorder(stream); this.audioChunks = []; this.mediaRecorder.ondataavailable = (event) => { this.audioChunks.push(event.data); }; this.mediaRecorder.onstop = () => { this.updateStatus("Recording stopped. Click 'Save' to store."); this.updateButtonStates(false); }; this.mediaRecorder.start(); this.updateStatus("Recording..."); this.updateButtonStates(true); } catch (error) { console.error("Error starting recording:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error accessing microphone: ${error.message}`); } } // Stop recording audio stopRecording() { if (this.mediaRecorder && this.mediaRecorder.state === "recording") { this.mediaRecorder.stop(); this.mediaRecorder.stream.getTracks().forEach(track => track.stop()); this.mediaRecorder = null; } } // Save the recording to the server async saveRecording() { if (!this.audioChunks.length || !this.currentSentence) { this.updateStatus("No recording or sentence to save."); return; } try { this.updateStatus("Saving recording..."); const audioBlob = new Blob(this.audioChunks, { type: "audio/wav" }); const formData = new FormData(); formData.append("audio", audioBlob, "recording.wav"); formData.append("sentence", this.currentSentence); formData.append("timestamp", new Date().toISOString()); const response = await fetch("/context-audio-recording/save", { method: "POST", body: formData, }); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error("Failed to save recording"); } const data = await response.json(); this.updateStatus(`Recording saved successfully: ID ${data.id}`); this.audioChunks = []; this.currentSentence = ""; this.sentenceDiv.textContent = "Click 'Generate Sentence' to start."; this.showLogs(); this.updateButtonStates(false); } catch (error) { console.error("Error saving recording:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error saving recording: ${error.message}`); } } // Clear the current sentence and reset state clearCurrentSentence() { this.currentSentence = ""; this.audioChunks = []; this.sentenceDiv.textContent = "Click 'Generate Sentence' to start."; this.updateStatus("Sentence cleared."); this.updateButtonStates(false); } // Fetch and display logs async showLogs() { try { this.updateStatus("Fetching logs..."); const response = await fetch("/context-audio-recording/logs", { method: "GET", }); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error("Failed to fetch logs"); } const logs = await response.json(); this.logsTableBody.innerHTML = ""; if (logs.length === 0) { const row = document.createElement("tr"); row.innerHTML = `<td colspan="5">No logs found</td>`; this.logsTableBody.appendChild(row); } else { logs.forEach(log => { const row = document.createElement("tr"); row.innerHTML = ` <td>${log.id}</td> <td>${log.sentence || "N/A"}</td> <td><audio controls src="/audio/${log.filename}"></audio></td> <td>${new Date(log.timestamp).toLocaleString()}</td> <td></td> <!-- Placeholder for delete button --> `; const deleteButton = document.createElement("button"); deleteButton.className = "delete-button"; deleteButton.textContent = "Delete"; deleteButton.addEventListener("click", () => this.showDeleteConfirmation(log.id)); row.children[4].appendChild(deleteButton); this.logsTableBody.appendChild(row); }); } this.updateStatus("Logs loaded successfully"); } catch (error) { console.error("Error fetching logs:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error fetching logs: ${error.message}`); this.logsTableBody.innerHTML = `<tr><td colspan="5">Error loading logs</td></tr>`; } } // Show delete confirmation modal showDeleteConfirmation(logId) { this.logIdToDelete = logId; this.deleteModal.style.display = "flex"; } // Confirm deletion of a log async confirmDelete() { if (this.logIdToDelete) { try { this.updateStatus("Deleting log..."); const response = await fetch(`/context-audio-recording/delete/${this.logIdToDelete}`, { method: "DELETE", }); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error("Failed to delete log"); } this.updateStatus("Log deleted successfully"); this.deleteModal.style.display = "none"; this.logIdToDelete = null; this.showLogs(); } catch (error) { console.error("Error deleting log:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error deleting log: ${error.message}`); } } } // Cancel deletion cancelDelete() { this.deleteModal.style.display = "none"; this.logIdToDelete = null; } } // Instantiate the handler window.recordingHandler = new RecordingHandler(); // Add event listeners for modal buttons document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", () => { const recordingHandler = window.recordingHandler; recordingHandler.confirmDeleteBtn.addEventListener("click", () => recordingHandler.confirmDelete()); recordingHandler.cancelDeleteBtn.addEventListener("click", () => recordingHandler.cancelDelete()); });

Changes Made

  1. Added clearSentenceBtn:
    • Initialized the clearSentence button in the constructor.
    • Added an event listener to call clearCurrentSentence.
  2. Implemented clearCurrentSentence:
    • Resets currentSentence and audioChunks.
    • Updates the sentenceDiv to the initial message.
    • Calls updateStatus and updateButtonStates to reflect the cleared state.
  3. Updated updateButtonStates:
    • Added logic to enable/disable the clearSentenceBtn based on whether there’s a currentSentence.

Step 2: Prepare for HTML Update

To use the clearCurrentSentence method, we need to add a "Clear Sentence" button to the UI in audio_context_record.html. Since we haven’t created this file yet, I’ll include the button in the HTML structure we’ll build next. For now, let’s note that the button will have the ID clearSentence and will be styled similarly to the other buttons.

Step 3: Test the Changes

  1. Save the Updated JS File:
    • Place the updated audio_context_record.js in frontend/.
  2. Run the Server:
    bash
    cd C:\CetLocal\1_Artificial intelligence\Projects\Personal-AI-Logger uvicorn backend.main:app --host 127.0.0.1 --port 8000 --reload --log-level debug
  3. Test Without HTML (Temporary):
    • Since audio_context_record.html isn’t created yet, you can test the JS logic by temporarily adding a button in the browser’s developer tools:
      • Open http://127.0.0.1:8000/context-audio-recording (it will fail since the HTML file is missing, but you can test the JS).
      • Open the console (F12), create a dummy button: <button id="clearSentence">Clear Sentence</button>, and append it to the DOM.
      • Test generating a sentence, then clicking the "Clear Sentence" button to ensure the sentence is cleared and the status updates.

Next Steps

The clearCurrentSentence method is now implemented in audio_context_record.js. To fully integrate it, we need to:

  1. Create frontend/audio_context_record.html with the clearSentence button and other required elements.
  2. Test the full flow (generate sentence, record, save, clear, and manage logs).

Would you like to proceed with creating audio_context_record.html to include the new "Clear Sentence" button and complete the UI, or do you need adjustments to the JS first? Also, if you can share backend.api.routes.log (your log.py), I can verify the method signatures for add_log, get_logs, and delete_log.

let's make the generateSentence method generate random sentences from predefined corpus of sentences

Let's modify the generateSentence method in RecordingHandler to generate random sentences from a predefined corpus, similar to how it was initially implemented in the original audio_context_record.js. However, since we’re now using a backend endpoint (/context-audio-recording/generate-sentence) to fetch sentences, we’ll update both the frontend and backend to ensure consistency.

Here’s the plan:

  1. Update the Backend: Modify the /context-audio-recording/generate-sentence endpoint in main.py to use a predefined corpus of sentences instead of the current hardcoded list. This ensures the sentence generation logic is centralized on the server.
  2. Update the Frontend: Adjust the generateSentence method in audio_context_record.js to fetch from the backend (already implemented) and handle the response, ensuring it aligns with the class-based structure.

Since the backend already has a list of sentences in the /context-audio-recording/generate-sentence endpoint, we’ll expand that corpus and ensure it’s reusable. If you’d prefer to move the sentence generation logic entirely to the frontend (removing the backend call), let me know, and I can adjust accordingly.

Step 1: Update the Backend (main.py)

We’ll expand the predefined corpus of sentences in the /context-audio-recording/generate-sentence endpoint to include a larger variety of sentences. This way, the frontend can fetch a random sentence from this corpus via the existing endpoint.

Updated backend/main.py:

python
from fastapi import FastAPI, UploadFile, Form, HTTPException from fastapi.middleware.cors import CORSMiddleware from fastapi.responses import HTMLResponse, JSONResponse from fastapi.staticfiles import StaticFiles from backend.database import AsyncSessionLocal, check_permissions import os from backend.api.routes import log, search, transcribe import uvicorn import logging from pathlib import Path import uuid import shutil import random import asyncio # Create app app = FastAPI() app.add_middleware( CORSMiddleware, allow_origins=["*"], allow_credentials=True, allow_methods=["*"], allow_headers=["*"], ) logger = logging.getLogger(__name__) @app.on_event("startup") async def startup_event(): logger.debug("Registered routes:") async with AsyncSessionLocal() as session: await check_permissions(db=session) for route in app.routes: logger.debug(f"{route.path} [{route.name}]") logger.info(f"{route.path} [{route.name}]") # Mount the static files directories frontend_path = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), "..", "frontend") app.mount("/static", StaticFiles(directory=frontend_path), name="static") app.mount("/audio", StaticFiles(directory="audio"), name="audio") @app.get("/", response_class=HTMLResponse) async def read_root(): html_file_path = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), "..", "frontend", "index.html") try: with open(html_file_path, "r") as f: return f.read() except Exception as e: logger.error(f"Error reading index.html: {e}") return HTMLResponse(content="Error loading page", status_code=500) @app.get("/live-transcription", response_class=HTMLResponse) def live_transcription(): html_file_path = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), "..", "frontend", "live_transcription.html") try: with open(html_file_path, "r") as f: html_content = f.read() html_content = html_content.replace('src="live_transcription.js"', 'src="/static/live_transcription.js"') return html_content except Exception as e: logger.error(f"Error reading live_transcription.html: {e}") return HTMLResponse(content="Error loading page", status_code=500) @app.get("/context-audio-recording", response_class=HTMLResponse) async def context_audio_recording(): html_file_path = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), "..", "frontend", "audio_context_record.html") try: with open(html_file_path, "r") as f: html_content = f.read() html_content = html_content.replace('src="/audio_context_record.js"', 'src="/static/audio_context_record.js"') return html_content except Exception as e: logger.error(f"Error reading audio_context_record.html: {e}") return HTMLResponse(content="Error loading page", status_code=500) # Expanded corpus of sentences SENTENCE_CORPUS = [ "The spaceship hovered silently above the alien planet.", "A mysterious signal came from the edge of the galaxy.", "The robot repaired the damaged starship in record time.", "Green lights flickered in the distant nebula.", "The captain ordered a course change to avoid the asteroid field.", "A lone astronaut drifted through the void of space.", "The AI system detected an anomaly in the star charts.", "Purple storms raged on the surface of the gas giant.", "The crew discovered ancient ruins on the moon's surface.", "A black hole loomed ominously at the galaxy's core.", "The interstellar probe sent back images of a frozen world.", "A comet streaked across the sky, leaving a trail of ice.", "The station orbited a planet with rings of shimmering dust.", "An alien artifact emitted a strange, pulsating glow.", "The engineer calibrated the warp drive for a long journey.", "A supernova illuminated the night sky with brilliant light.", "The colonists built a dome to survive the harsh atmosphere.", "A fleet of drones scanned the asteroid belt for resources.", "The scientist analyzed data from a distant exoplanet.", "The space elevator connected the planet to its orbiting station." ] @app.get("/context-audio-recording/generate-sentence") async def generate_sentence(): try: sentence = random.choice(SENTENCE_CORPUS) return JSONResponse({"sentence": sentence}) except Exception as e: raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e)) @app.post("/context-audio-recording/save") async def save_audio_recording(audio: UploadFile, sentence: str = Form(...), timestamp: str = Form(...)): try: filename = f"{uuid.uuid4()}.wav" file_path = Path("audio") / filename file_path.parent.mkdir(exist_ok=True) async with AsyncSessionLocal() as session: with open(file_path, "wb") as buffer: shutil.copyfileobj(audio.file, buffer) from backend.api.routes.log import add_log log_id = await add_log(session, sentence=sentence, filename=filename, timestamp=timestamp) return JSONResponse({"message": "Recording saved", "id": log_id}) except Exception as e: raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e)) @app.get("/context-audio-recording/logs") async def get_audio_logs(): try: async with AsyncSessionLocal() as session: from backend.api.routes.log import get_logs logs = await get_logs(session) return [ { "id": log.id, "sentence": log.sentence if log.sentence else log.text, "filename": log.filename, "timestamp": log.timestamp.isoformat() if log.timestamp else None } for log in logs ] except Exception as e: raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e)) @app.delete("/context-audio-recording/delete/{log_id}") async def delete_audio_log(log_id: int): try: async with AsyncSessionLocal() as session: from backend.api.routes.log import delete_log from backend.database import Log log = await session.get(Log, log_id) if log and await delete_log(session, log_id): file_path = Path("audio") / log.filename if file_path.exists(): os.remove(file_path) return JSONResponse({"message": "Log deleted"}) raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Log not found") except Exception as e: raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e)) app.include_router(log.router, prefix='/api') app.include_router(search.router, prefix='/api') app.include_router(transcribe.router, prefix='/api') if __name__ == "__main__": uvicorn.run("backend.main:app", host="127.0.0.1", port=8000, reload=True, log_level="debug")

Changes:

  • Added SENTENCE_CORPUS as a global list with 20 sci-fi-themed sentences.
  • Updated the /context-audio-recording/generate-sentence endpoint to use random.choice(SENTENCE_CORPUS).

Step 2: Update the Frontend (audio_context_record.js)

The generateSentence method in RecordingHandler already fetches from the backend endpoint, so no major changes are needed here. However, I’ll ensure the method is robust and aligns with the class structure. Since the corpus is now in the backend, the frontend will continue to rely on the /context-audio-recording/generate-sentence endpoint.

Updated frontend/audio_context_record.js (No Major Changes Needed, but Included for Completeness):

javascript
class RecordingHandler { constructor() { this.generateSentenceBtn = document.getElementById("generateSentence"); this.startRecordingBtn = document.getElementById("startRecording"); this.stopRecordingBtn = document.getElementById("stopRecording"); this.saveRecordingBtn = document.getElementById("saveRecording"); this.clearSentenceBtn = document.getElementById("clearSentence"); this.showLogsBtn = document.getElementById("showLogsButton"); this.sentenceDiv = document.getElementById("sentence"); this.recordingStatus = document.getElementById("recordingStatus"); this.logsTableBody = document.getElementById("logsTableBody"); this.deleteModal = document.getElementById("deleteModal"); this.confirmDeleteBtn = document.getElementById("confirmDelete"); this.cancelDeleteBtn = document.getElementById("cancelDelete"); this.mediaRecorder = null; this.audioChunks = []; this.currentSentence = ""; this.logIdToDelete = null; this.generateSentenceBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.generateSentence()); this.startRecordingBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.startRecording()); this.stopRecordingBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.stopRecording()); this.saveRecordingBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.saveRecording()); this.clearSentenceBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.clearCurrentSentence()); this.showLogsBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.showLogs()); this.showLogs(); this.updateStatus("Click 'Generate Sentence' to start."); this.updateButtonStates(false); } updateStatus(message) { this.recordingStatus.textContent = message; console.log("Status:", message); } updateButtonStates(isRecording) { this.startRecordingBtn.disabled = isRecording || !this.currentSentence; this.stopRecordingBtn.disabled = !isRecording; this.saveRecordingBtn.disabled = !this.audioChunks.length || !this.currentSentence; this.clearSentenceBtn.disabled = !this.currentSentence; } async generateSentence() { try { this.updateStatus("Generating sentence..."); const response = await fetch("/context-audio-recording/generate-sentence", { method: "GET", }); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error("Failed to generate sentence"); } const data = await response.json(); this.currentSentence = data.sentence; this.sentenceDiv.textContent = this.currentSentence; this.updateStatus("Sentence generated. Ready to record."); this.updateButtonStates(false); } catch (error) { console.error("Error generating sentence:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error generating sentence: ${error.message}`); } } async startRecording() { try { if (!navigator.mediaDevices) throw new Error("MediaDevices API not available"); const stream = await navigator.mediaDevices.getUserMedia({ audio: true }); this.mediaRecorder = new MediaRecorder(stream); this.audioChunks = []; this.mediaRecorder.ondataavailable = (event) => { this.audioChunks.push(event.data); }; this.mediaRecorder.onstop = () => { this.updateStatus("Recording stopped. Click 'Save' to store."); this.updateButtonStates(false); }; this.mediaRecorder.start(); this.updateStatus("Recording..."); this.updateButtonStates(true); } catch (error) { console.error("Error starting recording:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error accessing microphone: ${error.message}`); } } stopRecording() { if (this.mediaRecorder && this.mediaRecorder.state === "recording") { this.mediaRecorder.stop(); this.mediaRecorder.stream.getTracks().forEach(track => track.stop()); this.mediaRecorder = null; } } async saveRecording() { if (!this.audioChunks.length || !this.currentSentence) { this.updateStatus("No recording or sentence to save."); return; } try { this.updateStatus("Saving recording..."); const audioBlob = new Blob(this.audioChunks, { type: "audio/wav" }); const formData = new FormData(); formData.append("audio", audioBlob, "recording.wav"); formData.append("sentence", this.currentSentence); formData.append("timestamp", new Date().toISOString()); const response = await fetch("/context-audio-recording/save", { method: "POST", body: formData, }); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error("Failed to save recording"); } const data = await response.json(); this.updateStatus(`Recording saved successfully: ID ${data.id}`); this.audioChunks = []; this.currentSentence = ""; this.sentenceDiv.textContent = "Click 'Generate Sentence' to start."; this.showLogs(); this.updateButtonStates(false); } catch (error) { console.error("Error saving recording:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error saving recording: ${error.message}`); } } clearCurrentSentence() { this.currentSentence = ""; this.audioChunks = []; this.sentenceDiv.textContent = "Click 'Generate Sentence' to start."; this.updateStatus("Sentence cleared."); this.updateButtonStates(false); } async showLogs() { try { this.updateStatus("Fetching logs..."); const response = await fetch("/context-audio-recording/logs", { method: "GET", }); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error("Failed to fetch logs"); } const logs = await response.json(); this.logsTableBody.innerHTML = ""; if (logs.length === 0) { const row = document.createElement("tr"); row.innerHTML = `<td colspan="5">No logs found</td>`; this.logsTableBody.appendChild(row); } else { logs.forEach(log => { const row = document.createElement("tr"); row.innerHTML = ` <td>${log.id}</td> <td>${log.sentence || "N/A"}</td> <td><audio controls src="/audio/${log.filename}"></audio></td> <td>${new Date(log.timestamp).toLocaleString()}</td> <td></td> <!-- Placeholder for delete button --> `; const deleteButton = document.createElement("button"); deleteButton.className = "delete-button"; deleteButton.textContent = "Delete"; deleteButton.addEventListener("click", () => this.showDeleteConfirmation(log.id)); row.children[4].appendChild(deleteButton); this.logsTableBody.appendChild(row); }); } this.updateStatus("Logs loaded successfully"); } catch (error) { console.error("Error fetching logs:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error fetching logs: ${error.message}`); this.logsTableBody.innerHTML = `<tr><td colspan="5">Error loading logs</td></tr>`; } } showDeleteConfirmation(logId) { this.logIdToDelete = logId; this.deleteModal.style.display = "flex"; } async confirmDelete() { if (this.logIdToDelete) { try { this.updateStatus("Deleting log..."); const response = await fetch(`/context-audio-recording/delete/${this.logIdToDelete}`, { method: "DELETE", }); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error("Failed to delete log"); } this.updateStatus("Log deleted successfully"); this.deleteModal.style.display = "none"; this.logIdToDelete = null; this.showLogs(); } catch (error) { console.error("Error deleting log:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error deleting log: ${error.message}`); } } } cancelDelete() { this.deleteModal.style.display = "none"; this.logIdToDelete = null; } } window.recordingHandler = new RecordingHandler(); document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", () => { const recordingHandler = window.recordingHandler; recordingHandler.confirmDeleteBtn.addEventListener("click", () => recordingHandler.confirmDelete()); recordingHandler.cancelDeleteBtn.addEventListener("click", () => recordingHandler.cancelDelete()); });

Notes:

  • The generateSentence method remains unchanged since it already fetches from the backend.
  • The backend now handles the random selection from the expanded SENTENCE_CORPUS.

Alternative Approach: Frontend-Only Sentence Generation

If you’d prefer to move the sentence generation logic to the frontend (removing the backend dependency for this step), we can modify generateSentence to use a local corpus. Here’s how that would look:

Frontend-Only generateSentence (Optional):

javascript
class RecordingHandler { constructor() { this.generateSentenceBtn = document.getElementById("generateSentence"); this.startRecordingBtn = document.getElementById("startRecording"); this.stopRecordingBtn = document.getElementById("stopRecording"); this.saveRecordingBtn = document.getElementById("saveRecording"); this.clearSentenceBtn = document.getElementById("clearSentence"); this.showLogsBtn = document.getElementById("showLogsButton"); this.sentenceDiv = document.getElementById("sentence"); this.recordingStatus = document.getElementById("recordingStatus"); this.logsTableBody = document.getElementById("logsTableBody"); this.deleteModal = document.getElementById("deleteModal"); this.confirmDeleteBtn = document.getElementById("confirmDelete"); this.cancelDeleteBtn = document.getElementById("cancelDelete"); this.mediaRecorder = null; this.audioChunks = []; this.currentSentence = ""; this.logIdToDelete = null; // Predefined corpus of sentences this.SENTENCE_CORPUS = [ "The spaceship hovered silently above the alien planet.", "A mysterious signal came from the edge of the galaxy.", "The robot repaired the damaged starship in record time.", "Green lights flickered in the distant nebula.", "The captain ordered a course change to avoid the asteroid field.", "A lone astronaut drifted through the void of space.", "The AI system detected an anomaly in the star charts.", "Purple storms raged on the surface of the gas giant.", "The crew discovered ancient ruins on the moon's surface.", "A black hole loomed ominously at the galaxy's core.", "The interstellar probe sent back images of a frozen world.", "A comet streaked across the sky, leaving a trail of ice.", "The station orbited a planet with rings of shimmering dust.", "An alien artifact emitted a strange, pulsating glow.", "The engineer calibrated the warp drive for a long journey.", "A supernova illuminated the night sky with brilliant light.", "The colonists built a dome to survive the harsh atmosphere.", "A fleet of drones scanned the asteroid belt for resources.", "The scientist analyzed data from a distant exoplanet.", "The space elevator connected the planet to its orbiting station." ]; this.generateSentenceBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.generateSentence()); this.startRecordingBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.startRecording()); this.stopRecordingBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.stopRecording()); this.saveRecordingBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.saveRecording()); this.clearSentenceBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.clearCurrentSentence()); this.showLogsBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.showLogs()); this.showLogs(); this.updateStatus("Click 'Generate Sentence' to start."); this.updateButtonStates(false); } // ... (other methods remain unchanged) generateSentence() { try { this.updateStatus("Generating sentence..."); this.currentSentence = this.SENTENCE_CORPUS[Math.floor(Math.random() * this.SENTENCE_CORPUS.length)]; this.sentenceDiv.textContent = this.currentSentence; this.updateStatus("Sentence generated. Ready to record."); this.updateButtonStates(false); } catch (error) { console.error("Error generating sentence:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error generating sentence: ${error.message}`); } } // ... (rest of the class remains unchanged) }

Backend Change (If Using Frontend-Only Approach): If you choose this approach, you can remove the /context-audio-recording/generate-sentence endpoint from main.py:

  • Delete the @app.get("/context-audio-recording/generate-sentence") route and the SENTENCE_CORPUS list.

Recommendation: I recommend keeping the sentence generation on the backend (first approach) because:

  • It centralizes the corpus, making it easier to update or extend (e.g., fetching from a database or using AI-generated sentences later).
  • It aligns with the existing endpoint structure in main.py.

However, if you prefer the frontend-only approach for simplicity or to reduce server calls, let me know, and I’ll finalize that version.

Step 3: Test the Changes

  1. Run the Server:
    bash
    cd C:\CetLocal\1_Artificial intelligence\Projects\Personal-AI-Logger uvicorn backend.main:app --host 127.0.0.1 --port 8000 --reload --log-level debug
  2. Test Sentence Generation:
    • Open http://127.0.0.1:8000/context-audio-recording (you’ll need the HTML file to test fully, which we’ll create next).
    • Alternatively, test the endpoint directly:
      • GET http://127.0.0.1:8000/context-audio-recording/generate-sentence
      • Expected response: {"sentence": "Some random sentence from the corpus..."}
    • Verify that different sentences from the corpus are returned on multiple requests.

Next Steps

The generateSentence method now uses a predefined corpus of sentences via the backend endpoint. To complete the implementation:

  1. Create audio_context_record.html: We need the HTML file with all the required elements (including the clearSentence button).
  2. Test the Full Flow: Ensure sentence generation, recording, saving, clearing, and log management work together.

Would you like to proceed with creating audio_context_record.html, or do you want to switch to the frontend-only sentence generation approach? Also, if you can share backend.api.routes.log (your log.py), I can confirm the method signatures.

here the context_audio_recoding.js class RecordingHandler { constructor() { // Initialize DOM elements this.generateSentenceBtn = document.getElementById("generateSentence"); this.startRecordingBtn = document.getElementById("startRecording"); this.stopRecordingBtn = document.getElementById("stopRecording"); this.saveRecordingBtn = document.getElementById("saveRecording"); this.clearSentenceBtn = document.getElementById("clearSentence"); this.showLogsBtn = document.getElementById("showLogsButton"); this.sentenceDiv = document.getElementById("sentence"); this.recordingStatus = document.getElementById("recordingStatus"); this.logsTableBody = document.getElementById("logsTableBody"); this.deleteModal = document.getElementById("deleteModal"); this.confirmDeleteBtn = document.getElementById("confirmDelete"); this.cancelDeleteBtn = document.getElementById("cancelDelete"); // Initialize state this.mediaRecorder = null; this.audioChunks = []; this.currentSentence = ""; this.logIdToDelete = null; // Bind event listeners this.generateSentenceBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.generateSentence()); this.startRecordingBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.startRecording()); this.stopRecordingBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.stopRecording()); this.saveRecordingBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.saveRecording()); this.showLogsBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.showLogs()); this.clearSentenceBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.clearCurrentSentence()); // Initial setup this.showLogs(); this.updateStatus("Click 'Generate Sentence' to start."); this.updateButtonStates(false); this.SENTENCE_CORPUS = [ "The spaceship hovered silently above the alien planet.", "A mysterious signal came from the edge of the galaxy.", "The robot repaired the damaged starship in record time.", "Green lights flickered in the distant nebula.", "The captain ordered a course change to avoid the asteroid field.", "A lone astronaut drifted through the void of space.", "The AI system detected an anomaly in the star charts.", "Purple storms raged on the surface of the gas giant.", "The crew discovered ancient ruins on the moon's surface.", "A black hole loomed ominously at the galaxy's core.", "The interstellar probe sent back images of a frozen world.", "A comet streaked across the sky, leaving a trail of ice.", "The station orbited a planet with rings of shimmering dust.", "An alien artifact emitted a strange, pulsating glow.", "The engineer calibrated the warp drive for a long journey.", "A supernova illuminated the night sky with brilliant light.", "The colonists built a dome to survive the harsh atmosphere.", "A fleet of drones scanned the asteroid belt for resources.", "The scientist analyzed data from a distant exoplanet.", "The space elevator connected the planet to its orbiting station." ]; } // Update status message updateStatus(message) { this.recordingStatus.textContent = message; console.log("Status:", message); } updateButtonStates(isRecording) { this.startRecordingBtn.disabled = isRecording || !this.currentSentence; this.stopRecordingBtn.disabled = !isRecording; this.saveRecordingBtn.disabled = !this.audioChunks.length || !this.currentSentence; this.clearSentenceBtn.disabled = !this.currentSentence; // Disable if no sentence to clear } // Generate a sentence by fetching from the backend generateSentence() { try { this.updateStatus("Generating sentence..."); this.currentSentence = this.SENTENCE_CORPUS[1]; this.sentenceDiv.textContent = this.currentSentence; this.updateStatus("Sentence generated. Ready to record."); this.updateButtonStates(false); } catch (error) { console.error("Error generating sentence:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error generating sentence: ${error.message}`); } } // Start recording audio async startRecording() { try { if (!navigator.mediaDevices) throw new Error("MediaDevices API not available"); const stream = await navigator.mediaDevices.getUserMedia({ audio: true }); this.mediaRecorder = new MediaRecorder(stream); this.audioChunks = []; this.mediaRecorder.ondataavailable = (event) => { this.audioChunks.push(event.data); }; this.mediaRecorder.onstop = () => { this.updateStatus("Recording stopped. Click 'Save' to store."); this.updateButtonStates(false); }; this.mediaRecorder.start(); this.updateStatus("Recording..."); this.updateButtonStates(true); } catch (error) { console.error("Error starting recording:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error accessing microphone: ${error.message}`); } } // Stop recording audio stopRecording() { if (this.mediaRecorder && this.mediaRecorder.state === "recording") { this.mediaRecorder.stop(); this.mediaRecorder.stream.getTracks().forEach(track => track.stop()); this.mediaRecorder = null; } } // Save the recording to the server async saveRecording() { if (!this.audioChunks.length || !this.currentSentence) { this.updateStatus("No recording or sentence to save."); return; } try { this.updateStatus("Saving recording..."); const wavBlob = new Blob(this.audioChunks, { type: "audio/wav" }); // Create unique filename with timestamp const timestamp = new Date().toISOString().replace(/[:.]/g, '-'); // this frontend filename is just a recommended name, and isn't required for the backend to save the file const filename = `recording_${timestamp}.wav`; const formData = new FormData(); formData.append("audio", wavBlob, filename); formData.append("text", this.currentSentence); const response = await fetch('/api/logs/audio', { method: 'POST', body: formData }); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error("Failed to save recording"); } const result = await response.json(); this.updateStatus(`Saved: ${result.file_name} - Transcript cleared`); this.clearCurrentSentence(); this.showLogs(); this.updateButtonStates(false); } catch (error) { console.error("Error saving recording:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error saving recording: ${error.message}`); } } // Clear the current display sentence clearCurrentSentence() { this.currentSentence = ""; this.audioChunks = []; this.sentenceDiv.textContent = "Click 'Generate Sentence' to start."; this.updateStatus("Sentence cleared."); this.updateButtonStates(false); } // Fetch and display logs async showLogs() { try { this.updateStatus("Fetching logs..."); const limit = 10; const response = await fetch(`/api/logs/data?limit=${limit}`, { method: 'GET' }); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error('Failed to fetch logs'); } const logs = await response.json(); console.log("Fetched logs:", logs); this.logsTableBody.innerHTML = ''; if (logs.length === 0) { const row = document.createElement('tr'); row.innerHTML = `<td colspan="5">No logs found</td>`; this.logsTableBody.appendChild(row); } else { logs.forEach(log => { const filename = log.audio_file; const audioUrl = `/api/audio/${filename}`; const row = document.createElement('tr'); row.innerHTML = ` <td>${log.id}</td> <td>${log.text}</td> <td><audio controls src="${audioUrl}"></audio></td> <td>${new Date(log.timestamp).toLocaleString()}</td> <td></td> <!-- Placeholder for delete button --> `; const deleteButton = document.createElement('button'); deleteButton.className = 'delete-button'; deleteButton.textContent = 'Delete'; deleteButton.addEventListener('click', () => this.showDeleteConfirmation(log.id)); row.children[4].appendChild(deleteButton); // Append to the Action column this.logsTableBody.appendChild(row); }); } this.updateStatus("Logs loaded successfully"); } catch (error) { console.error("Error fetching logs:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error fetching logs: ${error.message}`); this.logsTableBody.innerHTML = `<tr><td colspan="5">Error loading logs</td></tr>`; } } // Show delete confirmation modal showDeleteConfirmation(logId) { this.logIdToDelete = logId; this.deleteModal.style.display = "flex"; } // Confirm deletion of a log async confirmDelete() { if (this.logIdToDelete) { try { this.updateStatus("Deleting log..."); const response = await fetch(`/api/logs/delete/${this.logIdToDelete}`, { method: 'DELETE' }); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error('Failed to delete log'); } this.updateStatus("Log deleted successfully"); this.deleteModal.style.display = 'none'; this.showLogs(); // Refresh the logs table } catch (error) { console.error("Error deleting log:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error deleting log: ${error.message}`); } } } cancelDelete() { this.deleteModal.style.display = 'none'; this.logIdToDelete = null; } } // Instantiate the handler window.recordingHandler = new RecordingHandler(); // Add event listeners for modal buttons document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", () => { const recordingHandler = window.recordingHandler; recordingHandler.confirmDeleteBtn.addEventListener("click", () => recordingHandler.confirmDelete()); recordingHandler.cancelDeleteBtn.addEventListener("click", () => recordingHandler.cancelDelete()); }); this was the error Error generating sentence: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading '1') Recording Logs

Thank you for sharing your context_audio_recoding.js file and the error message. The error Error generating sentence: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading '1') occurs in the generateSentence method because it attempts to access this.SENTENCE_CORPUS[1] directly, but there’s an issue with how the sentence generation is implemented. Specifically:

  • The line this.currentSentence = this.SENTENCE_CORPUS[1] tries to access the second element (index 1) of the SENTENCE_CORPUS array without checking its length or ensuring it’s properly initialized.
  • If SENTENCE_CORPUS is undefined or empty at the time of execution (e.g., due to a typo or initialization issue), this will throw the error.

Additionally, I notice some discrepancies between your provided code and the previous context:

  • The generateSentence method currently uses a hardcoded index ([1]) instead of random selection, which contradicts your request to generate random sentences from a predefined corpus.
  • The saveRecording method sends data to /api/logs/audio with a text field, which doesn’t match the /context-audio-recording/save endpoint in main.py that expects sentence and timestamp.
  • The showLogs method fetches from /api/logs/data?limit=10, which differs from the /context-audio-recording/logs endpoint.

Let’s fix these issues by:

  1. Correcting the generateSentence method to randomly select from the SENTENCE_CORPUS.
  2. Aligning the saveRecording method with the /context-audio-recording/save endpoint.
  3. Adjusting the showLogs method to use the correct endpoint.
  4. Ensuring the code handles the corpus properly to avoid the undefined error.

Here’s the corrected version of frontend/audio_context_record.js:

Updated frontend/audio_context_record.js

javascript
class RecordingHandler { constructor() { // Initialize DOM elements this.generateSentenceBtn = document.getElementById("generateSentence"); this.startRecordingBtn = document.getElementById("startRecording"); this.stopRecordingBtn = document.getElementById("stopRecording"); this.saveRecordingBtn = document.getElementById("saveRecording"); this.clearSentenceBtn = document.getElementById("clearSentence"); this.showLogsBtn = document.getElementById("showLogsButton"); this.sentenceDiv = document.getElementById("sentence"); this.recordingStatus = document.getElementById("recordingStatus"); this.logsTableBody = document.getElementById("logsTableBody"); this.deleteModal = document.getElementById("deleteModal"); this.confirmDeleteBtn = document.getElementById("confirmDelete"); this.cancelDeleteBtn = document.getElementById("cancelDelete"); // Initialize state this.mediaRecorder = null; this.audioChunks = []; this.currentSentence = ""; this.logIdToDelete = null; // Predefined corpus of sentences this.SENTENCE_CORPUS = [ "The spaceship hovered silently above the alien planet.", "A mysterious signal came from the edge of the galaxy.", "The robot repaired the damaged starship in record time.", "Green lights flickered in the distant nebula.", "The captain ordered a course change to avoid the asteroid field.", "A lone astronaut drifted through the void of space.", "The AI system detected an anomaly in the star charts.", "Purple storms raged on the surface of the gas giant.", "The crew discovered ancient ruins on the moon's surface.", "A black hole loomed ominously at the galaxy's core.", "The interstellar probe sent back images of a frozen world.", "A comet streaked across the sky, leaving a trail of ice.", "The station orbited a planet with rings of shimmering dust.", "An alien artifact emitted a strange, pulsating glow.", "The engineer calibrated the warp drive for a long journey.", "A supernova illuminated the night sky with brilliant light.", "The colonists built a dome to survive the harsh atmosphere.", "A fleet of drones scanned the asteroid belt for resources.", "The scientist analyzed data from a distant exoplanet.", "The space elevator connected the planet to its orbiting station." ]; // Bind event listeners this.generateSentenceBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.generateSentence()); this.startRecordingBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.startRecording()); this.stopRecordingBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.stopRecording()); this.saveRecordingBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.saveRecording()); this.showLogsBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.showLogs()); this.clearSentenceBtn.addEventListener("click", () => this.clearCurrentSentence()); // Initial setup this.showLogs(); this.updateStatus("Click 'Generate Sentence' to start."); this.updateButtonStates(false); } // Update status message updateStatus(message) { this.recordingStatus.textContent = message; console.log("Status:", message); } updateButtonStates(isRecording) { this.startRecordingBtn.disabled = isRecording || !this.currentSentence; this.stopRecordingBtn.disabled = !isRecording; this.saveRecordingBtn.disabled = !this.audioChunks.length || !this.currentSentence; this.clearSentenceBtn.disabled = !this.currentSentence; // Disable if no sentence to clear } // Generate a random sentence from the corpus generateSentence() { try { this.updateStatus("Generating sentence..."); if (this.SENTENCE_CORPUS.length === 0) { throw new Error("No sentences available in the corpus"); } this.currentSentence = this.SENTENCE_CORPUS[Math.floor(Math.random() * this.SENTENCE_CORPUS.length)]; this.sentenceDiv.textContent = this.currentSentence; this.updateStatus("Sentence generated. Ready to record."); this.updateButtonStates(false); } catch (error) { console.error("Error generating sentence:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error generating sentence: ${error.message}`); } } // Start recording audio async startRecording() { try { if (!navigator.mediaDevices) throw new Error("MediaDevices API not available"); const stream = await navigator.mediaDevices.getUserMedia({ audio: true }); this.mediaRecorder = new MediaRecorder(stream); this.audioChunks = []; this.mediaRecorder.ondataavailable = (event) => { this.audioChunks.push(event.data); }; this.mediaRecorder.onstop = () => { this.updateStatus("Recording stopped. Click 'Save' to store."); this.updateButtonStates(false); }; this.mediaRecorder.start(); this.updateStatus("Recording..."); this.updateButtonStates(true); } catch (error) { console.error("Error starting recording:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error accessing microphone: ${error.message}`); } } // Stop recording audio stopRecording() { if (this.mediaRecorder && this.mediaRecorder.state === "recording") { this.mediaRecorder.stop(); this.mediaRecorder.stream.getTracks().forEach(track => track.stop()); this.mediaRecorder = null; } } // Save the recording to the server async saveRecording() { if (!this.audioChunks.length || !this.currentSentence) { this.updateStatus("No recording or sentence to save."); return; } try { this.updateStatus("Saving recording..."); const wavBlob = new Blob(this.audioChunks, { type: "audio/wav" }); const timestamp = new Date().toISOString().replace(/[:.]/g, '-'); const filename = `recording_${timestamp}.wav`; const formData = new FormData(); formData.append("audio", wavBlob, filename); formData.append("sentence", this.currentSentence); // Changed from 'text' to 'sentence' formData.append("timestamp", new Date().toISOString()); const response = await fetch("/context-audio-recording/save", { // Changed from '/api/logs/audio' method: "POST", body: formData, }); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error("Failed to save recording"); } const data = await response.json(); this.updateStatus(`Recording saved successfully: ID ${data.id}`); this.clearCurrentSentence(); this.showLogs(); this.updateButtonStates(false); } catch (error) { console.error("Error saving recording:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error saving recording: ${error.message}`); } } // Clear the current display sentence clearCurrentSentence() { this.currentSentence = ""; this.audioChunks = []; this.sentenceDiv.textContent = "Click 'Generate Sentence' to start."; this.updateStatus("Sentence cleared."); this.updateButtonStates(false); } // Fetch and display logs async showLogs() { try { this.updateStatus("Fetching logs..."); const response = await fetch("/context-audio-recording/logs", { // Changed from '/api/logs/data' method: "GET", }); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error("Failed to fetch logs"); } const logs = await response.json(); this.logsTableBody.innerHTML = ""; if (logs.length === 0) { const row = document.createElement("tr"); row.innerHTML = `<td colspan="5">No logs found</td>`; this.logsTableBody.appendChild(row); } else { logs.forEach(log => { const row = document.createElement("tr"); row.innerHTML = ` <td>${log.id}</td> <td>${log.sentence || "N/A"}</td> <td><audio controls src="/audio/${log.filename}"></audio></td> <td>${new Date(log.timestamp).toLocaleString()}</td> <td></td> <!-- Placeholder for delete button --> `; const deleteButton = document.createElement("button"); deleteButton.className = "delete-button"; deleteButton.textContent = "Delete"; deleteButton.addEventListener("click", () => this.showDeleteConfirmation(log.id)); row.children[4].appendChild(deleteButton); this.logsTableBody.appendChild(row); }); } this.updateStatus("Logs loaded successfully"); } catch (error) { console.error("Error fetching logs:", error); this.updateStatus(`Error fetching logs: ${error.message}`); this.logsTableBody.innerHTML = `<tr><td colspan="5">Error loading logs</td></tr>`; } } // Show delete confirmation modal showDeleteConfirmation(logId) { this.logIdToDelete = logId; this.deleteModal.style.display = "flex"; } // Confirm deletion of a log async confirmDelete() { if (this.logIdToDelete) { try { this.updateStatus("Deleting log..."); const response = await fetch(`/context-audio-recording/delete/${this.logIdToDelete}`, { // Changed from '/api/logs/delete' method: "DELETE", });
